referveo: <entryFree id="n40794" type="main" key="re^ferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fervĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bubble up; to boil over.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">refervens falsum crimen in purissimam et castissimam vitam collatum statim concidit et exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refervesco: <entryFree id="n40795" type="hapax" key="re^fervesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfervesco</orth>, <itype>fervi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [referveo], <hi rend="ital">to boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bubble up</hi>: qui (sanguis) <cb n="REFI" /> refervescere videretur sic, ut tota domus sanguine redundaret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refestino: <entryFree id="n40796" type="main" key="re^festi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-festīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hasten back again</hi> (late Lat.), Ruf. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
refibulo: <entryFree id="n40797" type="hapax" key="re^fi_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fībŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unclasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbuckle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unloose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:28:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 28, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reficio: <entryFree id="n40798" type="main" key="re^fi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum</itype> (AEDIFICIA REFACTA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3115</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n40798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in condition again; to remake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruit</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; syn.: renovo, restauro, redintegro). </sense><sense id="n40798.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40798.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis citius dissolvi posse videmus Quam rursus refici, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:557 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 557 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud ex alio reficit natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt amissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, tela, alia quae spe pacis amiserat, reficere, Sall J. 66, 1: testamentum jure militari,</quote> <trans><tr>to make anew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: reficere sic accipimus ad pristinam formam iter et actum reducere, hoc est, ne quis dilatet aut producat deprimat aut ex aggeret; <cit><quote lang="la">longe enim aliud est reficere, aliud facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 19, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reficere est, quod corruptum est, in pristinum statum restaurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes curator muris reficiendis fuit, eosque refecit pecumā suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top 3, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana reficienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates quassas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa Aedisque labentes deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros, classem, portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1</bibl>; 5, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 23: pontem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 35</bibl></cit>; 7, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 58; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labore assiduo reficiendae urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">copias ex dilectibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill up</tr>, <tr>recruit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">semper enim refice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paulum modo res essent refectae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam,</quote> <trans><tr>to rekindle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:144" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40798.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40798.4" n="1" level="3"> Econom. and mercant. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to make again</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to get back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get in return</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reddo, recipio): nemo sanus debet velle impensam ac sumptum facere in culturam, si videt non posse refici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam eris dives ante, quam tibi ex tuis possessionibus tantum reficiatur, ut eo tueri sex legiones possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:88" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tanto plus sibi mercedis ex fundo refectum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inde refectum est, militi divisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex venditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:39:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 39, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensas belli alio bello refecturus,</quote> <trans><tr>to replace</tr>, <tr>defray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40798.5" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' t. t.: reficere consulem, tribunum, praetorem, etc., <hi rend="ital">to appoint anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reappoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-elect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos, consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Voleronem tribunum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul factus, refectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40798.6" n="II" level="1"> Trop </sense><sense id="n40798.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to restore</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (naufragio rei publicae) colligendo, ac reficiendā salute communi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 6, 15</bibl></cit>. refecta fides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40798.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of the body or mind, <hi rend="ital">to make strong again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reinvigorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruit</hi> ( = recreare, renovare; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n40798.9" n="1" level="3"> Of the body; constr. class. usu. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case> of <hi rend="ital">disease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toil</hi>, etc.; rarely with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ex labore atque inopiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad reficiendum militem ex jactatione maritimā, Liv 30, 29, 1: morbus ex quo tum primum reficiebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites hibernorum quiete a laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves quiete et pabulo laeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucios cum cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tironis reficiendi spes est in M. Curio,</quote> <trans><tr>of curing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 17, § 66</bibl></cit> (al. recipiat): <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saltus reficit jam roscida luna,</quote> <trans><tr>refreshes</tr>, <tr>revives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras herbas (Aurora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:711" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ex magnis caloribus in Arpinati me refeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab imbecillitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 68, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum salis refectis ab jactatione maritumā militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply with se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labore refici ac reparari videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:77:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 77, 6</bibl></cit>: ex vulnere refici, <cb n="REFL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex longo morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40798.10" n="2" level="3"> Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vester conspectus et consessus iste reficit et recreat mentem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me recreat et reficit Pompeii consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reficiat animos ac reparet varietas ipsa (dicendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with renovare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ex forensi strepitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refecti sunt militum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reficit animos Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 67 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ad animum, sed ad vultum ipsum reficiendum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cheer up</tr>, <tr>clear up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea quae dicturus sum reficite vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refectā tandem spe,</quote> <trans><tr>restored</tr>, <tr>renewed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum repetitio et congregatio memoriam judicis reficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl>, prooem. § 6. — Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refreshed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorated; comp.</hi>, refectior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Cap 2:section=139" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Cap 2, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refictio: <entryFree id="n40799" type="main" key="re^ficti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = refectio, q. v.</entryFree>
refigo: <entryFree id="n40800" type="main" key="re^fi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unfix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unloose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pluck down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num figentur rursus eae tabulae, quas vos decretis vestris refixistis?</quote> <trans><tr>have taken down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affixis hostium spoliis, quae nec emptori refigere liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clipeo refixo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum de poste Neptuni sacro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa Parthorum templis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeos captos in bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>to pull out</tr>, <tr>extract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refigere se crucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">refixum corpus interfectoris cremavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:7:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 7, 11</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo refixa sidera,</quote> <trans><tr>loosened</tr>, <tr>falling down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hasta refixas vendit opes,</quote> <trans><tr>the plundered goods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 497</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40800.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40800.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take down</hi> the tables of the laws suspended in public, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrogate</hi> laws: <cit><quote lang="la">acta M. Antonii rescidistis, leges refixistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aera refigere debeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: fixit leges pretio atque refixit, <hi rend="ital">for a bribe</hi>, Verg, A. 6, 622.— * </sense><sense id="n40800.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: quo facilius nostra refigere deportareque tuto possimus, Curius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refiguro: <entryFree id="n40801" type="hapax" key="re^fi^gu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fĭgūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refashion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 19, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refingo: <entryFree id="n40802" type="main" key="re^fingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make anew</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n40802.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: rem, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 108 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">cerea regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 202</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40802.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetiorem me refingens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M 3, p. 134, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refirmatus: <entryFree id="n40803" type="hapax" key="re^firma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-firmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [firmo], <sense id="n40803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fixed again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-established</hi>: limes, Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
refixus: <entryFree id="n40804" type="main" key="re^fixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from refigo.</entryFree>
reflabilis: <entryFree id="n40805" type="hapax" key="re^fla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reflo</etym>, <sense id="n40805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that evaporates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
reflabri: <entryFree id="n40806" type="hapax" key="re_^flabri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^flabri</orth> (sc. venti) = reciproci, <sense id="n40806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blowing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing counter</hi> (opp. excursores venti, qui directo spirant), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 62, 21</bibl> [reflo].</sense></entryFree>
reflagito: <entryFree id="n40807" type="main" key="re^fla_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flāgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to demand again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand back</hi> (only in the two foll. pass.): <cit><quote lang="la">persequamur eam et reflagitemus ... Circumsistite eam et reflagitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit> and 10.</sense></entryFree>
reflatio: <entryFree id="n40808" type="hapax" key="re^fla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reflo</etym>, <sense id="n40808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evaporation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
reflatus: <entryFree id="n40809" type="main" key="re^fla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium reflatu beluae oppletum unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>; concr., <hi rend="ital">a contrary wind</hi>: naves delatas Uticam reflatu hoc, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 2, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40809.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">reaction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doceat me, si potest, quae sit illa vis (sc. fortunae), qui flatus iste, et qui reflatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 28, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reflecto: <entryFree id="n40810" type="main" key="re^flecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flecto</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n40810.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards; to turn about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40810.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudam canum degeneres sub alvum reflectunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 50, 111, § 265</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:199" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 78, § 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput leviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem inde (sc. ex Labyrintho) sospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go back</tr>, <tr>return</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 428" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum subito ad Contrebiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 341</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:455" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 455</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(elephantorum) dentes reflexi,</quote> <trans><tr>tusks</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 165</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cornu (with adunco aere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 731" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornicula (scarabaei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 100</bibl></cit>: cervix. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 535</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 779</bibl>: <pb n="1547" /> <cb n="REFO" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 382</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: illam tereti cervice reflexam,</quote> <trans><tr>bending herself back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 633</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">telum reflexum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:54" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 54</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: (Ascalaphus) in caput crescit, longosque reflectitur ungues, <hi rend="ital">he bends himself back into long claws</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his nails are bent back and lengthened into claws</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 547</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40810.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi>: quem neque fides, neque jusjurandum ... Repressit neque reflexit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam animum incitatum ad ulciscendam orationem tuam revoco ipse et reflecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (causis) mentes aut incitantur aut reflectuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 155" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum reflexi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I reflected within myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 741</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem ad Romanam urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in melius tua, qui potes, orsa reflectas!</quote> <trans><tr>change</tr>, <tr>alter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 632</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to reverse</hi> a proposition or inference: <cit><quote lang="la">reflexim inferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 36, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 411</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n40810.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn back;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to give way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam morbi reflexit causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 502</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reflexim: <entryFree id="n40811" type="main" key="re^flexim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flexim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>reflecto</etym>, <sense id="n40811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conversely</hi> (opp. directim), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 34, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 411</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reflexio: <entryFree id="n40812" type="main" key="re^flexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40812.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bending</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cervicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40812.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the conversion of a proposition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 33, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 412</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reflexus: <entryFree id="n40813" type="main" key="re^flexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from reflecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40814" type="main" key="re^flexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reflecto</etym>, <sense id="n40814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 6, p. 342, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <trans><tr>return</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reflo: <entryFree id="n40815" type="main" key="re^flo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40815.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow contrary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40815.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reflantibus ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiae valde reflant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum procellae reflantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 8</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: pelagus respargit, reflat, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 158 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n40815.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prospero flatu ejus (fortunae) utimur, ad exitus pervehimur optatos et, cum reflavit, affligimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reflante fortunā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40815.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40815.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To blow again from one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) cum ducitur atque reflatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is breathed out</tr>, <tr>exhaled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum, folles,</quote> <trans><tr>to blow out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucositatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to evaporate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40815.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puff out again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laciniam (ventus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reflato sinu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 158 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum veste reflatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 116, 7.</sense></entryFree>
refloresco: <entryFree id="n40816" type="main" key="re^flo_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flōresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to bloom again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blossom again.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40816.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:160" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 47, § 160</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40816.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:738" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 738</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caro mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 27, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refluamen: <entryFree id="n40817" type="main" key="re^flu^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflŭāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>refluo</etym>, <sense id="n40817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which flows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">runs off</hi>: grammaticae refluamina guttae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">grammatical trifles</hi>, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:29" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refluo: <entryFree id="n40818" type="main" key="re^flu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run back;</hi> <hi rend="ital">to flow off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Maeandros ambiguo lapsu refluitque fluitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refluit amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 240</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 32</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the tide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 213</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refluus: <entryFree id="n40819" type="main" key="re^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>refluo</etym>, <sense id="n40819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refluent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 100, § 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:624" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:91" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <trans><tr>from which the sea recedes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assueti refluas dominorum lambere micas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. Pasch. 3, 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refocillatrix: <entryFree id="n40820" type="main" key="re^fo^cilla_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfŏcillātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the reviver</hi> (late Lat.), Aldh. Septen. col. 167, t. 83 Migne.</sense></entryFree>
refocillo: <entryFree id="n40821" type="main" key="re^fo^cillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fŏcillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm into life again; to revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revivify</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 15, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 16, 23</bibl>; 30, 12; Hier. Vit. Malch. § 10.</sense></entryFree>
refodio: <entryFree id="n40822" type="main" key="re^fo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dig out again</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">summas radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:4" default="NO">3, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum quam altissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orestis corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 16, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices refossae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora refossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reformabilis: <entryFree id="n40823" type="main" key="re^forma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-formābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be formed again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reformatio: <entryFree id="n40824" type="main" key="re^forma_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕformātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reformo</etym>, <sense id="n40824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transformation</hi><cb n="REFO" />  (very rare). </sense><sense id="n40824.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of a <hi rend="ital">metamorphosis</hi> into an ass, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>, p. 263, 19. — </sense><sense id="n40824.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> and pregn., <hi rend="ital">a reformation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reformator: <entryFree id="n40825" type="hapax" key="re^forma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕformātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reformo</etym>, <sense id="n40825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transformer;</hi> pregn., <hi rend="ital">a reformer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum senescentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reformatus: <entryFree id="n40826" type="hapax" key="re^forma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕformātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transformation</hi>: aeonum, Tert. ad. Val. 13.</sense></entryFree>
reformidatio: <entryFree id="n40827" type="hapax" key="re^formi_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕformīdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reformido</etym>, <sense id="n40827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reformido: <entryFree id="n40828" type="main" key="re^formi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-formīdo</orth>, no <sense id="n40828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to fear greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand in awe of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">avoid through fear</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40828.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui imbecillius horrent dolorem et reformidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea fugiat et reformidet oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines maritimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO">10, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensionem vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:section=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem loquendi morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritatis memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum mentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae studium et praecepta prudentium penitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40828.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea dicere reformidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparari tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 4</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n40828.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, quid tibi de alio audienti, de se ipso occurrat, reformidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n40828.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se reformidare, quod in senatu Pompeius dixisset, ad quos legati mitterentur, iis auctoritatem attribui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, quam non reformidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40828.5" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim fides mea custodem repudiat, diligentia speculatorem reformidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum bracchia (vitium) tonde: Ante reformidant ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reformidant insuetum lumina solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens reformidat tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reformidat vulnus humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:666" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra mollem quoque saucia tactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medentium manus crudum adhuc vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 20</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">putatio non debet secundum articulum fieri, ne reformidet oculus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be checked in its growth</tr>, <tr>cease growing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:11:1" default="NO">4, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:15" default="NO">4, 24, 15</bibl>; 4, 33, 4.</sense></entryFree>
reformo: <entryFree id="n40829" type="main" key="re^formo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shape again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metamorphose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed preme, quicquid erit, dum, quod fuit ante, reformet,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>until she resumes her first shape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 254</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 399</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus in facies hominum tales figuras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in alienam personam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (asinum) ad homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 264, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus humilitatis nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudorum pedes ad officium gradiendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40829.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40829.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinae providentiae fatalis dispositio subverti vel reformari non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 217, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias in pejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Themistocles ruinas patriae in pristinum habitum reformaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n40829.4" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to amend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reform;</hi> of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">(quadragenarius pupillus) non potest reformari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed reformamini in novitate sensūs vestri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: imitari proposita et ad illa reformare chirographum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:51" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores depravatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 53, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">solutam et perditam disciplinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40829.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refossus: <entryFree id="n40830" type="main" key="re^fossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from refodio.</entryFree>
refotus: <entryFree id="n40831" type="main" key="re^fo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from refoveo.</entryFree>
refoveo: <entryFree id="n40832" type="main" key="re^fo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>fōvi, fōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cherish again; to refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi>, etc. (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40832.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus refoventque foventque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artus admoto igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrictos artus complexibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 67</bibl></cit> Cort.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentia membra quiete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:637" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes tepidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 19, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires mollitia caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:113:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 113, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:1" default="NO">1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:521" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 521</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">refotus calidis piscinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refoveatur stercoratione terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: a lassitudine viae <cb n="REFR" /> sedilibus refotae (sorores). <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 160, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem poculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 122.—</sense><sense id="n40832.2" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">leni afflatu simulacra refovente,</quote> <trans><tr>animating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 22, § 98</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40832.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia prope exstincta refoventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam castrorum lapsam exstinctamque refovisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:69:5" default="NO" valid="yes">69, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā pace cuncta refovente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias internis certaminibus fessas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias partium in Africā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calefacto simul refotoque animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solaciis,</quote> <trans><tr>to comfort</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refractariolus: <entryFree id="n40833" type="hapax" key="re_^fracta_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fractārĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [refractarius], <hi rend="ital">somewhat stubborn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refractory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciale dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refractarius: <entryFree id="n40834" type="hapax" key="re_^fracta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fractārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>refringo</etym>, <sense id="n40834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stubborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refractory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumaces ac refractarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refractus: <entryFree id="n40835" type="main" key="re_^fractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from refringo.</entryFree>
refraenatio: <entryFree id="n40836" type="main" key="re_^fraena_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fraenātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fraeno</orth>, v. re, fren-.</entryFree>
refragatio: <entryFree id="n40837" type="main" key="re_^fra_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frāgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refragor</etym>, <sense id="n40837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 177" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refragator: <entryFree id="n40838" type="main" key="re_^fra_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frāgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opponent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversary</hi>: Ciceronis, Ascon. ad Or. in Tog. Cand. (p. 83 Orell.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refragium: <entryFree id="n40839" type="main" key="re_^fra_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 35, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40839.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstacle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Ep. 37, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refragor: <entryFree id="n40840" type="main" key="re_^fra_gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-frāgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n40840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, a publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist; to thwart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gainsay</hi> (one who sues for a thing; opp. suffragor). </sense><sense id="n40840.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa lex petitioni tuae refragata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne refragari homini amicissimo videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus honori (sc. triumpho),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40840.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi> (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: repugno, adversor): tacita quaedam cogitatio refragatur his omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non refragetur ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca refragatur veneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae suae non refragari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si materia non refragetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refrenatio: <entryFree id="n40841" type="main" key="re_^fre_na_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frēnātio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">refraen-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refreno</etym>, <sense id="n40841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bridling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restraining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refreno: <entryFree id="n40842" type="main" key="re_^fre_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-frēno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">refraeno</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n40842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold in with a bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40842.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold back.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40842.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 531</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiem per membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 276</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copiam materiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 283</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40842.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">religione refrenari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda refrenat morsus voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1085" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1085</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes a gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a reditu refrenavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitam audeat Refrenare licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum conscientiă sceleris avaritiaeque suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium opibus refrenare ac coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">27: neque hac re severitas Papirii refrenari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refrico: <entryFree id="n40843" type="main" key="re_^fri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-frĭco</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n40843.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scratch open again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fret</hi> (a favorite word of Cic.; otherwise rare). </sense><sense id="n40843.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 18</bibl></cit>, a, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obductam jam cicatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40843.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to excite afresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam pulcherrimi facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae praeterita fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum memoria refricare coeperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illa vetus fabula refricaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus desiderium ac dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitu refricatur amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n40843.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break out afresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro refricat lippitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refrigeratio: <entryFree id="n40844" type="main" key="re_^fri_ge^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frīgĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refrigero</etym>. <sense id="n40844.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cooling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coolness</hi>: refrigeratio aestate, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40844.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mitigation</hi> of diseases, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 56, 1</bibl>. <pb n="1548" /> <cb n="REFR" /></sense></entryFree>
refrigeratorius: <entryFree id="n40845" type="main" key="re_^fri_ge^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frīgĕrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>refrigero</etym>, <sense id="n40845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cooling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refrigeratory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura (lentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis (seminis cicutae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 151</bibl></cit>: potio, Pelag. Vet. 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
refrigeratrix: <entryFree id="n40846" type="main" key="re_^fri_ge^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frīgĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refrigerator</etym>, <sense id="n40846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that cools; cooling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura refrigeratrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refrigerium: <entryFree id="n40847" type="main" key="re_^fri_ge^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frīgĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cooling;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a mitigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:65:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 65, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Tim. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Avar. 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refrigero: <entryFree id="n40848" type="main" key="re_^fri_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-frīgĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cool</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cold; to cool off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cool</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40848.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis in aquam conjectus continuo restinguitur et refrigeratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigerato et exstincto calore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me frigus Dalmaticum, quod illinc ejecit, etiam hic refrigeravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">membra partim ardentia partim refrigerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 28, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">granaria (ventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad refrigeratur aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronianas thermas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:25:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl>: novum (vinum) refrigerare, vetus calefacere, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigerant olera, coriandrum, cucumis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceto summa vis est in refrigerando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40848.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>: membra refrigerat unda. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 903</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi enim potest illa aetas aut calescere vel apricatione melius vel igni aut vicissim umbris aquisve refrigerari salubrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: refrigerandi sui causā, Suet. Vit. Luc. — </sense><sense id="n40848.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cool off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of warmth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">zeal;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be cooled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhausted;
