to grow cool</hi> or <hi rend="ital">languid</hi> (cf. defervesco): <cit><quote lang="la">defessā ac refrigeratā accusatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigerato jam levissimo sermone hominum provincialium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigerato inventionis amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Antonii librarius . . . refrigeratus, ab Antonio transfugit ad Caesarem,</quote> <trans><tr>his zeal having cooled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 2</bibl></cit>: prudens (testis) aliquo urbane dicto refrigerandus est, qs. <hi rend="ital">to throw cold water upon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to intimidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre perlegit, refrigeratus saepe a semetipso,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>being often stopped</tr>, <tr>interrupted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl></cit>. —Esp. in late Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to refresh</tr>, <tr>comfort</tr>, <tr>assist</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Scap. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me refrigeravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 23, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refrigescentia: <entryFree id="n40849" type="main" key="re_^fri_gescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frīgescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refrigesco</etym>, = refrigeratio, II., <sense id="n40849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alleviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refrigesco: <entryFree id="n40850" type="main" key="re_^fri_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-frīgesco</orth>, <itype>frixi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow cold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cool</hi> (class.; most freq. in the trop. sense, and in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n40850.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi id vinum refrixerit, in dolium refundito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor vulnere laesum refrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis vel calescit vel refrigescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40850.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow cold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remiss; to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow stale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose interest; to fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flag</hi> in strength or zeal: <cit><quote lang="la">illud crimen de nummis caluit re recenti, nunc in causā refrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor ille cogitationis, qui scribendi morā refrixit, recepit ex integro vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli apparatus refrigescent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res interpellata bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta Caesaris,</quote> <trans><tr>to go on coldly</tr>, <tr>to flag</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit> Manut.; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 17, 2: oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines mora stili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes plane,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have gone quite out of use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de Pompeio Caninius agit, sane quam refrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Romae a judiciis forum refrixerit,</quote> <trans><tr>has a cessation from judicial business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: Domitius cum Messalā certus esse videbatur; <cit><quote lang="la">Scaurus refrixerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had given up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Memmius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charitas multorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refringo: <entryFree id="n40851" type="main" key="re_^fringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-fringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n40851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break open</hi> (class.; syn.: perfringo, dissicio). </sense><sense id="n40851.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: postes portasque, Enn. ap. <cb n="REFU" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 622</bibl>, and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 61</bibl> (Ann. v. 271 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9</bibl> et saep. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatii fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:595" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 595</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebam et revolvere in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totas refringere vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radium solis refringi,</quote> <trans><tr>is refracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 59, 60, § 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40851.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break off</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quae demersa liquore obeunt, refracta videntur Omnia convorti sursumque supina revorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refringit virgulta pede vago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 86</bibl></cit>: ramum, <hi rend="ital">to break off</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 210</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mucronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 17, § 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aculeos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas (Hyleus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:139" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 139</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40851.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotentem dominationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Teutonicas opes, Frop. 3, 3 (4, 2), 44: nec Priami domus Achivos refringit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniorum impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra pudoris et reverentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: verba, <hi rend="ital">to mutilate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mangle speech</hi>, like children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:123" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refriva: <entryFree id="n40852" type="main" key="re_^fri_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^frīva</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fĕrīva făba</orth>, <sense id="n40852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">which was carried home at seed-time to be sacrificed</hi>, as a good omen: <cit><quote lang="la">refriva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=277" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 277</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(refriva) fabam utique e frugibus referre mos est auspicii causā, quae ideo referiva appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 119</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
refrondesco: <entryFree id="n40853" type="hapax" key="re_^frondesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-frondesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be covered with leaves again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow green again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refuga: <entryFree id="n40854" type="main" key="re_^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^fŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>refugio</etym>, <sense id="n40854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a runaway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fugitive</hi> (post-class. for perfuga, transfuga), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13:section=5" default="NO">49, 16, 13, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refugio: <entryFree id="n40855" type="main" key="re^fu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n40855.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee back; to run away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40855.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex castris in montem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 99</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex caede in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:36" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex cursu ad Philippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Parthiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie refugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 449</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc. of distance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille fugit refugitque vias (cervus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admissis equis ad suos refugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per devios tramites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40855.3" n="2" level="3"> Of things: refugiat timido sanguen, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 218</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl> (Trag. v. 46 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) ubi medio refugerit orbe,</quote> <trans><tr>shrinks from sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites a caulibus ut a pestiferis et nocentibus refugere dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: refugere oculi, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pridie refugisset (mare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40855.4" n="b" level="4"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to run back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recede</hi> in the distance: <cit><quote lang="la">refugit ab litore templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 536</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oculis visa refugit humus,</quote> <trans><tr>flees</tr>, <tr>disappears</tr>, <tr>vanishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:590" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam praestat a mari longo potius intervallo quam brevi refugisse (villas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40855.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne recordatione mei casus a consiliis fortibus refugiatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:23:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 23, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab institutā consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac orationis turpitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a genere hoc toto sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum recordationes fugio . . . refugio a te admonendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab iis quae laedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus luctu refugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugit animus eaque dicere reformidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: possum multa tibi veterum praecépta referre, Ni refugis, <hi rend="ital">if you do not decline</hi> (to hear them), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 177</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n40855.6" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take refuge with</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ad legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcem majorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad planctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad carminis tranquillitatem tamquam ad portum faciliorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40855.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run away from</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n40855.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: impetum armati Antiochi ceterorumque tela atque incursus refugit,<cb n="REFU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem refugit (animal), id contra naturam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo id refugisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Cassium obvium sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidus repente refugit Attollentem iras (anguem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cupido) refugit te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Polyhymnia Lesboum refugit tendere barbiton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40855.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">refugit Foeda ministeria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina jurgia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicatam modulandi voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctionem quaestionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod malum casurum putat refugit mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 48</bibl></cit> Miill.: <cit><quote lang="la">et alia, quae nunc memoriam meam refugiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>escape my memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem natura refugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 172:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 172, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refugium: <entryFree id="n40856" type="main" key="re^fu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>refugio</etym>, <sense id="n40856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a taking refuge</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; cf.: perfugium, asylum). </sense><sense id="n40856.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n40856.2" n="A" level="2"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas refugiis profugorum aperuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 4, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40856.3" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a place of refuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a refuge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae tutius dedere refugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugium abscondendi causā servo praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 3, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugia aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos refugia montium receperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40856.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refuge</hi>: regum, populorum, nationum portus erat et refugium senatus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus refugium pauperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugia salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refugus: <entryFree id="n40857" type="main" key="re^fu^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleeing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanishing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Virg. or Hor.): unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flumen (with fugientia poma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:634" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites irritato proelio sponte refugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <trans><tr>vanishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:41" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugosque gerens a fronte capillos,</quote> <trans><tr>flying back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 132</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">jejunii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 20, § 4.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfŭgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugos sequi,</quote> <trans><tr>fugitives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refulgentia: <entryFree id="n40858" type="hapax" key="re^fulgenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfulgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n40858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reflected lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refulgence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacunarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 359, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refulgeo: <entryFree id="n40859" type="main" key="re^fulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>si</itype> (collat. form refulgit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 800</bibl> Lachm.), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flash back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect a shining light; to shine bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n40859.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 800</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervidus ille Canis stellarum luce refulget, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 114: Cynosura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautis Stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sol a liquidā saepe refulget aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caerula nubes Solis inardescit radiis longeque refulget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea radiis refulget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas clarā in luce refulsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 588</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 590</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus roseā cervice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus versicolori veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discolor auri aura per ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 204</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis refulgentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">late refulgent Ossibus campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:190" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 190</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40859.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidaque a docto fama refulget aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 19), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis Tutela refulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dolosi spes refulserit nummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum refulsit certa spes liberorum parentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:103:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 103, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refundo: <entryFree id="n40860" type="main" key="re^fundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour back; to pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to overflow</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n40860.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quibus (vaporibus) altae renovataeque stellae atque omnis aether refundunt eodem et rursum trahunt indidem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor refundit in aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponto refuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem, v. B. infra: luna glaciem refundit,</quote> <trans><tr>melts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 101, 104, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imis Stagna refusa vadis,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 126</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheronte refuso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda refunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:465" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis refusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: refusus Oceanus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">flowing back into itself</hi> (the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">a)yo/rroos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 797</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40860.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things not liquid: <cit><quote lang="la">refunditur alga,</quote> <trans><tr>is flung back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit>: quam libenter tot spoliatis, tot trucidatis sanguinem et bona <pb n="1549" /> <cb n="REGA" /> refudisses, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hadst given back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 40, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">refudimus Nilo suas copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus venditori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem impensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:5:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 5, 5, § 4</bibl></cit>: huic dabis loricam, quam refundat, Val. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Claud. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">refusa Conjugis in gremium,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched out</tr>, <tr>lying at length</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refusis in spatium immensum campis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>outspread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:322" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 322</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40860.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletu super ora refuso,</quote> <trans><tr>pouring forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 657</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. profuso): necem in Tatiani consilia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to infuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 9</bibl></cit>: per cujus oboedientiam humani generis culpa deleta, refusa justitia est, <hi rend="ital">checked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfied</hi>, Ambros. Apol. David, 17, § 81.</sense></entryFree>
refuscatus: <entryFree id="n40861" type="main" key="re^fusca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fuscātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscured</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">luna sanguineo oculo refuscata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Compl. Apoc. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refuse: <entryFree id="n40862" type="hapax" key="re^fu_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>refusus</etym>, <sense id="n40862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overflowingly; comp.</hi>: refusius egesta humus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">mellowed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loosened by digging and fermenting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl> dub. (others read: refusus ex egestā humo).</sense></entryFree>
refusio: <entryFree id="n40863" type="main" key="re^fu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refundo</etym>, <sense id="n40863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40863.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a restitution</hi>: possessionum, Ambros. Apol. David, 8, § 42.</sense></entryFree>
refusorius: <entryFree id="n40864" type="hapax" key="re^fu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to giving back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>in which something is remitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refusus: <entryFree id="n40865" type="main" key="re^fu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from refundo.</entryFree>
refutabilis: <entryFree id="n40866" type="main" key="re^fu_ta_bi^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūtābĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>refuto</etym>, <sense id="n40866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be rejected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuted;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, § 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spir. Sanct. 2, 8, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refutatio: <entryFree id="n40867" type="main" key="re^fu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; <sense id="n40867.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in rhet.,</quote> <trans><tr>a refutation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:25:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 25, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:5" default="NO">3, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:15" default="NO">4, 3, 15</bibl>; 6, 3, 72.</sense></entryFree>
refutatiuncula: <entryFree id="n40868" type="main" key="re^fu_ta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūtātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refutatio</etym>, <sense id="n40868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">petty attempts at refutation</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Alterc. Ecc. et Syn. p. 1133.</sense></entryFree>
refutator: <entryFree id="n40869" type="main" key="re^fu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>refuto</etym>, <sense id="n40869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refuter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refutatorius: <entryFree id="n40870" type="main" key="re^fu_ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to refutation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refutatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 61, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 62, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refutatus: <entryFree id="n40871" type="hapax" key="re^fu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refutation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">refutatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 525</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refuto: <entryFree id="n40872" type="main" key="re^fu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root fu-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xu-, xevw, xeu=ma;</foreign> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundo, futtilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 204 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 204 sq.</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n40872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper illas nationes nostri imperatores refutandas potius bello quam lacessandas putaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: reicio, reprimo). </sense><sense id="n40872.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem aspernari ac refutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refutetur ac reiciatur ille clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:33:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 33, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: vitam, <hi rend="ital">to contemn</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 4, 218</bibl> (H. 1, 73 Dietsch); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem si te (Fors dicta refutet!) Prodiderim,</quote> <trans><tr>may fate avert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40872.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebut</hi> any thing by speech, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to confute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disprove</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">refello, redarguo): res refutat id,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:867" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 867</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo te ita refutandum ut gravem adversarium arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra confirmare argumentis ac rationibus, deinde contraria refutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>; so (opp. confirmare) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: neque refutanda tantum, sed contemnenda, elevanda, ridenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuria testimoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio re multo magis quam verbis refutata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiam pudicitiae posterae vitae castitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tum, ut pueri, refutare domesticis testibus solebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te refutentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos oratione feroci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis corpus sentire refutat,</quote> <trans><tr>denies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 350</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regaliolus: <entryFree id="n40873" type="hapax" key="re_ga_li^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgālĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>regalis</etym>, <sense id="n40873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the wren</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis regaliolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regalis: <entryFree id="n40874" type="main" key="re_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgālis</orth>, e. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rex</etym>, <sense id="n40874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40874.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40874.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: regalis corporis custodias agere, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 323, 1</bibl>: genus civitatis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 7, 15</bibl>; cf.: res <cb n="REGE" /> publica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30, 53</bibl></cit> (shortly afterwards: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen regis): imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomisma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus et sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam praestans et regale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sapere, sic divinare regale ducebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 40, 89</bibl></cit>: virgo, <hi rend="ital">a king</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s daughter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 697</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Lavinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>treating of kings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs pyramidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: regalia fulmina, quorum vi tangitur vel comitium vel principalia urbis liberae loca, quorum significatio regnum civitati minatur, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:49:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 49, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum rex regalior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus, quod regalissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 2:30" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 2, 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40874.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n40874.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Those belonging to a royal family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princes of the blood royal</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">basilikoi/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">regales decem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 26</bibl></cit>; so Cod. Th. 7, 19; cf. Gramm. ap. Putsch. p. 2205.— </sense><sense id="n40874.5" n="2" level="3"> REGALIVM ORDO, an unexplained phrase in an inscr. at Formiae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3884</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40874.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the residence of the king</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 17</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, trop.: animae regalia in capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:8:56" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 8, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40874.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">usual with kings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of a king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgā-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">royally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regally;</hi> in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio regaliter Minervae confecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>. 4. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea vero regalius initiabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40874.8" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">despotically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domineeringly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus minas regaliter addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regammans: <entryFree id="n40875" type="main" key="re^gammans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gammans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gamma</etym>, <sense id="n40875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the form of the digamma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">digammate</hi> (late Lat.): limes, Aggen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=62" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 62</bibl> Goes.: linea, Auct. Limit. p. 254 ib.</sense></entryFree>
regelatio: <entryFree id="n40876" type="main" key="re^ge^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĕlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>regelo</etym>, <sense id="n40876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thawing</hi> (late Lat.), Aggen. ap. Front. pp. 57 and 70 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
regelo: <entryFree id="n40877" type="main" key="re^ge^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĕlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, qs. to unfreeze, i. e. <sense id="n40877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thaw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warm</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40877.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum aedificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucina regelata manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:8:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites regelatae siccantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: Riphaeae torpentia frigore brumae, Col. poët. 10, 78. — * </sense><sense id="n40877.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam aetas mea contenta est suo frigore: vix mediā regelatur aestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40877.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cool off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">granaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regemo: <entryFree id="n40878" type="main" key="re^ge^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gĕmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to resound with sighs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">groans</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">abjunctis regemunt tabulata cavernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:389" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regemunt lacus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regeneratio: <entryFree id="n40879" type="main" key="re^ge^ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĕnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>regenero</etym>, <sense id="n40879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being born again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regeneration</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 19, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tit. 3, 5</bibl>: lavacrum regenerationis, <hi rend="ital">of baptism</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8, 5.</sense></entryFree>
regenero: <entryFree id="n40880" type="main" key="re^ge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40880.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproduce</hi> (Pliny and eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">signa quaedam naevosque et cicatrices etiam regenerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 10, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platani satae regeneravere vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40880.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth something similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse avum regeneravit Aethiopem,</quote> <trans><tr>represented</tr>, <tr>resembled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">patrem Tiberium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40880.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to regenerate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
regerminatio: <entryFree id="n40881" type="main" key="re^germi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgermĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>regermino</etym>, <sense id="n40881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a springing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprouting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">germinating again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:122" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 7, 36, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regermino: <entryFree id="n40882" type="main" key="re^germi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-germĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">germinate again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:122" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 7, 36, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:111" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regero: <entryFree id="n40883" type="main" key="re^ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi> (freq. only after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n40883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si summa terra sublata ex fundo meo et alia regesta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram e fossā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cb n="REGI" /></sense></entryFree>
regestum: <entryFree id="n40884" type="main" key="re^gestum1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n40884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">earth thrown up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:3" default="NO">4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO">3, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoquunt in ahenis levi igni duas partes (amurcae) quoad regerant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cause to fly off</tr>, <tr>evaporate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:64:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 64, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40884.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of written remarks, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in commentarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholas in hos commentarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 59</bibl></cit>.— Hence, in late Lat.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgesta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catalogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 2, § 2</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 1131.— </sense><sense id="n40884.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retort</hi> (cf. refero): Stoicos, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 19, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contagia regerimus,</quote> <trans><tr>wish away from us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 720" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in illos,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw the blame on them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 19</bibl></cit> (30), 2.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n40885" type="main" key="re^gestum2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. regero, I.</entryFree>
regestus: <entryFree id="n40886" type="main" key="re^gestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from regero.</entryFree>
regia: <entryFree id="n40887" type="main" key="re_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. regius, I. B.</entryFree>
regibilis: <entryFree id="n40888" type="main" key="re^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be ruled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regie: <entryFree id="n40889" type="main" key="re_gi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. regius <sense id="n40889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
regienses: <entryFree id="n40890" type="main" key="Re_gi^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgĭenses</orth>, v. Regium.</entryFree>
regifice: <entryFree id="n40891" type="main" key="re_gi^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. regificus <sense id="n40891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
regificus: <entryFree id="n40892" type="main" key="re_gi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭ-fĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rex - facio</etym>, <sense id="n40892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regal</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">epulae paratae Regifico luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 605</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae paratu Regifico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:652" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 652</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 3, 6, § 27</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">royally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>: instructa domus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 122 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">exstructae mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:273" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 273</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regifugium: <entryFree id="n40893" type="main" key="re_gi^fu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭ-fŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rex-fuga, the king's flight</etym>, <sense id="n40893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated on the</hi> 24<hi rend="ital">th of February</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commemorate the expulsion of the kings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Fer. Rom. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=279" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 279</bibl> ib.; Kalend. Maff. ap. Orell. Inscr. II. p. 384; <cit><quote lang="la">called regis fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:685" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 685</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regigno: <entryFree id="n40894" type="hapax" key="re^gigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gigno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beget</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reproduce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regillus: <entryFree id="n40895" type="main" key="re_gillus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [regius], <hi rend="ital">royal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: tunica, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 10</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. h. v. p. 286 Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40896" type="main" key="Re_gillus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n40896.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence Appius Claudius emigrated to Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16</bibl> Drak.; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgilli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgillānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgillensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Regillus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius Appius Regillanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius Regillensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40896.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small lake in Latium</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Cornufelle</hi>), <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the victory over the Latins gained there by the Romans under the dictator Postumius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also lacus Regillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 11, § 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Regilli lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 16" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 16</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgillensis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">surname of the</hi> Postumii: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Postumio Regillensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">A. et L. Postumii Regillenses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40896.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname in the Æmilian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Aemilius Regillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 38.</sense></entryFree>
regimen: <entryFree id="n40897" type="main" key="re^gi^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a guiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direction</hi> (freq. only after the Aug. per., esp. in. Tac.; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n40897.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen equorum exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">procellis regimen impedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis sermonisque regimen primores (dentes) tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40897.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a rudder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangitur et regimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen carinae Flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:593" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 593</bibl></cit>: cum magnus inhorruit Auster ... Non regimen prodest, Petr. poët. 123, 235. — </sense><sense id="n40897.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a guiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directing;
