rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40897.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: in quo (sc. animo) consilium vitae regimenque locatum est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen totius magistratūs penes Appium erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae rei penes Germanicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum legumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: in omnia<pb n="1550" /> <cb n="REGI" />  regimen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40897.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the direction of State affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278</bibl> (Ann. v. 400 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">id. ap. Censor. Fragm. c. 14 (Trag. v. 381 ib.): regimen suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen manu tractare cruentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:658" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 658</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40897.6" n="C" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen rerum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum humanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regimentum: <entryFree id="n40898" type="main" key="re^gi^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi> (post-class. for regimen); usually in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 1, 7</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>, Fest. s. v. regimen, p. 278 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
regina: <entryFree id="n40899" type="main" key="re_gi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rex; cf. the Sanscr. rāgni, the same</etym>, <sense id="n40899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a queen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40899.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40899.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 76</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:170 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 170 al.</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n40899.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of <hi rend="ital">Cleopatra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">Dido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">454</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">697</bibl>; 717.—Of <hi rend="ital">the wife of Latinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 659</bibl>. — Sarcastically: regina Bithynica, of <hi rend="ital">Cæsar</hi>, as paramour of King Nicomedes, Bibul. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>: sacrorum, <hi rend="ital">the wife of the</hi> rex sacrificulus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 137</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40899.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40899.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A goddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Venus, regina Gnidi Paphique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 26, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum regina bicornis, Luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calliope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina nemorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 406" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 406</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40899.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of a king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a princess</hi> (cf. rex and regulus); so of <hi rend="ital">Ariadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">Medea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 1</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">the daughters of Darius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:12" default="NO">3, 12, 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also in apposition: regina sacerdos (of Rhea Silvia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines reginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40899.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A noble woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lady</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed istae reginae domi Suae fuere ambae (opp. ancillae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia solae utuntur his reginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:64:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40899.8" n="D" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">she that is first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">silvestris regina chori,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the leader</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:379" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpini veluti regina cu pressus Verticis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appia regina viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40899.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a queen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi>, etc.: oratio omnium rerum regina, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 113, 32</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(justitia) omnium est domina et regina virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina Pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:55:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 55, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regio: <entryFree id="n40900" type="main" key="re^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n40900.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā regione viaï Declinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 249</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">notā excedo regione viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rectā regione deflecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eadem est nostrae rationis regio et via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 70</bibl></cit>, § 181; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi murus ab planitie rectā regione, si nullus anfractus intercederet, MCC. passus aberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">non rectā regione iter instituit, sed ad laevam flexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinamus item motus nec tempore certo, nec regione loci certā,</quote> <trans><tr>nor in a specified direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 260</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hercynia silva) rectā fluminis Danubii regione pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 46</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Curt 7, 7, 4: ubi primos superare regionem castrorum animum adverterunt,</quote> <trans><tr>the line</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam esse naturam et religionem provinciae tuae, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the situation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traicere amnem in regionem insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.2" n="B" level="2"> E regione, adverbially. </sense><sense id="n40900.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In a straight line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e regione moveri (opp. declinare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the rectilinear motion of atoms,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri, petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cadat e regione loci, quā dirigit aestus,</quote> <trans><tr>straight down</tr>, <tr>perpendicularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 823</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 833</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In the opposite direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly opposite;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40900.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(luna) cum est e regione solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat e regione oppidi collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris positis e regione unius eorum pontium, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio e regione castrorum relicto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 61</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates duplices e regione molis collocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e regione turris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: dicitis, esse e regione nobis e contrariā parte terrae, qui adversis vestigiis stent contra nostra vestigia, quos <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/podas</foreign> vocatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39</bibl>, <cb n="REGI" /> 123: <cit><quote lang="la">e regione castris castra ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40900.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie e regione instructā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40900.8" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: e contra): Arabes camelorum lacte vivunt, e regione septentrionales, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40900.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The line which bounds the sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the visual line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary-line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary</hi> (cf: limes, finis). </sense><sense id="n40900.11" n="1" level="3"> Primarily in the lang. of augury: <cit><quote lang="la">intra eas regiones, quā oculi conspiciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe eo (sc. lituo) Romulus regiones direxit tum, cum urbem condidit ... ab Attio Navio per lituum regionum facta descriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituus, quo regiones vincere terminavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionibus ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.12" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a boundary-line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary;</hi> usually in <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n40900.13" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anteponatur omnibus Pompeius, cujus res gestae atque virtutes iisdem quibus solis cursus regionibus ac terminis continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli regionibus terminare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis terrae regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 23</bibl></cit>. — Rare in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae regione orbem terrarum definiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.14" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (argumenti) nunc regiones, limites, confinia Determinabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus si, quibus regionibus vitae spatium circumscriptum est, eisdem omnes cogitationes terminaret suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (quaestionum) circumscripta modicis regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix facile sese regionibus officii continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40900.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi> of the heavens or the earth (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Nilus) exoriens penitus mediā ab regione diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 723</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 732</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam regio (lunae mutatur), quae tum est aquilonaris, tum australis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde subter mediam regionem sol obtinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque eadem regio Vesper et Ortus erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vespertina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Vitr 4, 5, 1: caeli in regione serenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 528</bibl></cit>: regione occidentis, Liv 33, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40900.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A portion</hi> (of the earth or heavens) of indefinite extent; <hi rend="ital">a tract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi> (cf.: tractus, plaga). </sense><sense id="n40900.17" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40900.18" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac regione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum delegit in regione pestilenti salubrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri fertilissima regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā te regione reliqui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regione portae Esquilinae,</quote> <trans><tr>in the region</tr>, <tr>neighborhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Drak.; 25, 25; 30; 33, 17; cf. Oud. de Auct. B. Alex. 30, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: e regione castrorum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the vicinity of the camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 43</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">eā regione quā Sergius erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam vasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acclivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta siti regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi loci sunt atque hae regiones, quae mihi ab ero sunt demonstratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur in his ego te conspicor regionibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui innumerabiles mundos infinitasque regiones mente peragravisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae maximae regiones inhabitabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n40900.19" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40900.20" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A portion of country</hi> of indefinite extent; <hi rend="ital">a territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region;</hi> esp. freq. in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">lands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territories</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at regione locoque alio terrisque remotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonium ad eam regionem, quae Aduaticis adjacet, depopulandam mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ejusmodi regione atque provinciā, quae mari cincta esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae regio orave terrarum erat latior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio Pedana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum hominum regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sogdiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cantium, quae regio est maritima omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae regio totius Galliae media habetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: Sida, quae extrema regio est provinciae meae, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi major atque illustrior incidit res, clamore per agros regionesque significant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes regionum atque pagorum inter suos jus dicunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias regiones partesque peteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so with partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde in quattuor regiones dividi Macedoniam. Unam fore et primam partem, quod, etc. . . . Secundam fore regionem, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erant propinquae regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam latissimas regiones praesidiis teneret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 44</bibl></cit>. — Sometimes <hi rend="ital">a district with its people</hi>: tractus ille celeberrimus, tota denique<cb n="REGI" />  nostra illa aspera et montuosa et felix et fautrix suorum regio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40900.21" n="(b)" level="5"> A principal division of the city of Rome, and of the territory around Rome, <hi rend="ital">a quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circle</hi> (of these, under Servius Tullius, there were in the city four, and in the Roman territory twenty-six; under Augustus, there were fourteen in the city), Laelius Felix ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 43, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4 sq.</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Niebuhr, Gesch. 1, p. 458 sq.: regio quaedam urbis aeternae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 10, 15</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of other cities,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6, 768</bibl></cit>.—Hence, A REGIONIBVS, <hi rend="ital">a captain of a quarter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 894, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">895, 4</bibl> and 5.— </sense><sense id="n40900.22" n="(g)" level="5"> Of the provinces into which Italy was divided by Augustus, <hi rend="ital">a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptionem ab eo (Augusto) factum Italiae totius in regiones undecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 11, 16, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 12, 17, § 106 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40900.23" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">department</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sphere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in regionem astutiarum mearum te induco, ut scias Juxta mecum mea consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque (consilium) situm mediā regione in pectoris haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 140</bibl></cit>: ceterae fere artes se ipsae per se tuentur singulae; <cit><quote lang="la">benedicere autem non habet definitam aliquam regionem, cujus terminis saepta teneatur,</quote> <trans><tr>has no determinate province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem est nostrae rationis regio et via,</quote> <trans><tr>compass and course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40900.24" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the field</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba regionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 17, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Joel, 1, 19: bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 31, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regionalis: <entryFree id="n40901" type="main" key="re^gi^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>regio</etym>, <sense id="n40901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a province</hi> or <hi rend="ital">region</hi>: concilium, <hi rend="ital">provincial</hi> (opp. plenarium), Aug. Bapt. contr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 7, 53</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭōnālĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by provinces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">regions</hi>, = regionatim, App. de Mundo, 23, p. 68, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:157" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regionatim: <entryFree id="n40902" type="main" key="re^gi^o_na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgĭōnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by districts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionatim commerciis interruptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 51</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(edidit) ludos regionatim Urbe totā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
registoria: <entryFree id="n40903" type="main" key="re^gisto_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgistōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>re-gero</etym>, <sense id="n40903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treasurer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Reg. ad Verg. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regiumrheg: <entryFree id="n40904" type="main" key="Re_gium (Rhe_g"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgium (Rhēg-</orth>) (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpĭdi</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n40904.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Via Aemilia, now <hi rend="ital">Reggio</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 78</bibl> and 3983.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Regium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40904.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in the southern part of Calabria on the Sicilian strait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now Reggio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33</bibl>, §§ 55, 56; 2, 4, 60, § 135; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl> (called Region, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 48</bibl>).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhēg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Regium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>, § 8.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40904.2" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Regium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 7, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40904.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commander on the southern coast</hi>, A. U. C. 705, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regius: <entryFree id="n40905" type="main" key="re_gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rex</etym>, <sense id="n40905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40905.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset habendus rex, quicumque genere regio natus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; 2, 23, 43; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 32, 56: nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 28, 51: civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 104</bibl></cit> et saep.: anni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the reign of the kings</hi> (at Rome), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of royal property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the eagle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus imperii proximum similitudini regiae,</quote> <trans><tr>very much resembling regal power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>with a king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regios nutus tueri,</quote> <trans><tr>purposes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia, crede mihi, res est succurrere lapsis,</quote> <trans><tr>befitting kings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regia res scelus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:595" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans><tr>princess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 570</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 523</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 783</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 189" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interitus regii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: superbum<pb n="1551" /> <cb n="REGN" />  istud et regium, nisi, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7, 6</bibl>.—Hence, esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex regia,</quote> <trans><tr>a law investing the emperor with all the power and authority of the Roman people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit> Sandars ad loc.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40905.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rē-gĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n40905.3" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. milites.) <hi rend="ital">The royal troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the king</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s soldiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40905.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The satraps of the king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the nobles of the royal court</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40905.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n40905.6" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. domus.) <hi rend="ital">A royal palace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the court</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aula, palatium): in regia regem ipsum quasi productum esse ad dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vestibulo regiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaedificata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiam occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:599" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 599</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polycratis regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40905.7" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the royal castle of Numa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the</hi> Sacra Via, <hi rend="ital">close by the temple of Vesta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used subsequently for priestly purposes</hi> (for appointed sacrifices, for meetings of the priests, as a residence of the Pontifex, etc.): haec est a sacris quae via nomen habet; Hic locus est Vestae, qui Pallada servat et ignem; <cit><quote lang="la">Hic fuit antiqui regia parva Numae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:264" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 12</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 37</bibl> Ascon.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl>, a, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:48 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 18, § 48 al.</bibl>— Hence, atrium regium, <hi rend="ital">the hall of this</hi> regia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40905.8" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40905.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The royal tent</hi> in a camp, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">armatus exercitus regiam obsedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:9" default="NO">6, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum regiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40905.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The court</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the royal family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the king and his courtiers</hi> (cf. aula; <cit><quote lang="la">first under Aug.): tulit et Romana regia sceleris tragici exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicunque propinquitate regiam contigisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callistus prioris quoque regiae peritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 13</bibl>; Petr. poët. 5, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 2</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n40905.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like aula, <hi rend="ital">a court for the cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cattle-yard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregis regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:67" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40905.12" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. urbs.) <hi rend="ital">A royal city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capital</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Croesi regia Sardes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non haec dotalis regia Amatae, i. e. Laurentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarea, Jubae regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40905.13" n="3" level="3"> A pure Lat. name for basilica, <hi rend="ital">a colonnade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portico</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hall</hi> (not ante-Aug.): dum lectica ex regiā domum redeo, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Ascon. ap. Cic. Aem. Scaur. § 45 (p. 27 Orell.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 30</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40905.14" n="4" level="3"> A pure Lat. name for the plant basilisca (v. h. v.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 128</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40905.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">royal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for the class. regalis): <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <trans><tr>splendid edifices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 12, 21</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As an epithet of any remarkable production of nature or art: olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:2" default="NO">12, 49, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO">12, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: regius morbus, <hi rend="ital">the jaundice</hi> (because it was said to be cured by delicate remedies, by exciting to cheerfulness, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 24</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 53, § 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 58, 1033</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 453</bibl>: regia stella, <hi rend="ital">a large star in the constellation</hi> Leo, <hi rend="ital">now called</hi> Regulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 235</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">royally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificently; imperiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despotically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accubabo regie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regie polita aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae regie seu potius tyrannice statuit in aratores Apronius,</quote> <trans><tr>imperiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudeliter et regie factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reglesco: <entryFree id="n40906" type="hapax" key="re^glesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-glesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>glisco</etym>, <sense id="n40906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augment</hi>: reglescit cum dixit Plautus, significat crescit hoc versu: Vix supersum dolori, qui in dies misero mihi ac perdito reglescit, Fest. s. h. v. p. 278, 30 Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=279:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 279, 5</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
reglutino: <entryFree id="n40907" type="main" key="re^glu_ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-glūtĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n40907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40907.1" n="I" level="1"> (Prop. to unglue, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">To unloose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 9</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reglutinatis luminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 586</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40907.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To join together again</hi>: amputatum plaga collum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 873.</sense></entryFree>
regnator: <entryFree id="n40908" type="main" key="regna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">regnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>regno</etym>, <sense id="n40908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereign</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): deūm regnator, Naev. ap. Fest. s. v. quianam, p. 257, 28 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 269</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cb n="REGN" /> summi Olympi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 558</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 437</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnator omnium deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corniger Hesperidum fluvius regnator aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:200" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae (Priamus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 557</bibl></cit> Wagn.: Neptunus regnator marum, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 770</bibl> P.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: freti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 945" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 945</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyricae cohortis (Pindarus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agelli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>owner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:61:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 61, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiduis regnator montibus Atlas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:621" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyricis regnator aquis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Danube</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 3</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Siciliā, ubi rex Agathocles regnator fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:6:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regnatrix: <entryFree id="n40909" type="hapax" key="regna_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">regnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n40909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi> [regnator], <hi rend="ital">ruling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reigning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo regnatrice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regnicola: <entryFree id="n40910" type="hapax" key="regni^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">regnĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>regnum-colo</etym>, <sense id="n40910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller in a kingdom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Faust. 20:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Faust. 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regno: <entryFree id="n40911" type="main" key="regno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">regno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [regnum]. </sense><sense id="n40911.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have royal power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Pterela rex regnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus cum septem et triginta regnavisset annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 27</bibl>; 2, 18, 33; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 20, 36: Servius injussu populi regnavisse traditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mithridates) annum jam tertium et vicesimum regnat, et ita regnat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium jam nunc annum regnans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnante Romulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Camers) tacitis regnavit Amyclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quālibet exules In parte regnanto beati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latio regnans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnandi dira cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albae regnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusco profundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graias per urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Colchis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advenae in nos regnaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—Once <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, like <foreign lang="greek">basileu/w,</foreign> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā Daunus agrestium Regnavit populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic jam ter centum totos regnabitur annos Gente sub Hectoreā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia post Tatii mortem ab suā parte non erat regnandum ... in variis voluntatibus regnari tamen omnes volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnatum Romae ab conditā urbe ad liberatam annos ducentos quadraginta quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Cytherea tuis longo regnabitur aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:592" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 592</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40911.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be lord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be supreme</hi> (syn. dominor); <cit><quote lang="la">in a good sense: quoniam equitum centurias tenes, in quibus regnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regnare in judiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivo et regno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 8</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., of the gods: caelo tonantem credimus Jovem Regnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturno regnante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:193" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundo Caesare regnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 52</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In a bad sense (very freq.),</quote> <trans><tr>to lord it</tr>, <tr>tyrannize</tr>, <tr>domineer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnavit is paucos menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin se ille interfecto Milone regnaturum putaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timarchidem fugitivum omnibus oppidis per triennium scitote regnasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam libertate contentos esse, nisi etiam regnent ac dominentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 29, 7</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so with dominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40911.3" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to reign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold sway</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">umor regnavit in arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ignis) per ramos victor regnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in totum regnaret Sirius annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:635" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum regnat rosa (i. e. at a banquet, where the guests were crowned with roses),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19, 20</bibl></cit>: quid faciant leges, ubi sola pecunia regnat? Petr. poët. 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 74</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40911.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have the mastery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predominate</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*paqhtiko/n,</foreign> in quo uno regnat oratio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 37, 128</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(eloquentia) hic regnat, hic imperat, hic sola vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:181" default="NO">11, 3, 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor edendi per avidas fauces regnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 829</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrietas geminata libidine regnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnat nequitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus regnans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 462</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40911.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose); <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat. of agent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra acri quondam regnata Lycurgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latio regnata per arva Saturno quondam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 794</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 623</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si unquam regnandam acceperit Albam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Lugios Gotones regnantur, paulo jam adductius quam ceterae Germanorum gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>: exceptis<cb n="REGO" />  iis gentibus quae regnantur, id. ib 25; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (gentes) regnan tur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:24" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens reg. nata feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regnum: <entryFree id="n40912" type="main" key="regnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">regnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rex</etym>, <sense id="n40912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kingly government</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royal authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kingship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royalty</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium, principatus): cum penes unum est omnium summa rerum, regem illum unum vocamus et regnum ejus rei publicae statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regique Thebano Creonti regnum stabilivit suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regno regem spoliare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob labefactandi regni timorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni initium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque potest ejusmodi res publica non regnum et esse et vocari,</quote> <trans><tr>royalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum in suā civitate occupare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: regnum reciperare, Auct. B. Alex. 36; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stabat regno incolumis regumque vigebat Consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tulli ignobile regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander periculoso regno securam ac tutam vitam anteponens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40912.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40912.2" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">possidere regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod imperium, qui magistratus, quod regnum potest esse praestantius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne regnum vel imperium bellis quaeritur et victoriis propagatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi a Caesare regnum civitatis deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te in meum regnum accepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoptione in regnum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes, quae in eorum (i. e. Populi Romani) regno ac dicione sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobile regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum sine vi tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum alicui permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae Sub regno Cinarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: nec regna vini sortiere talis, <hi rend="ital">the presiding over a drinking-bout</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)rxiposi/a,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 18</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter bibendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; v. also rex).— </sense><sense id="n40912.3" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">despotism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyranny</hi> (to a Roman of the time of the Republic, any sovereignty of a single individual): <cit><quote lang="la">hic ait se ille, judices, regnum meum ferre non posse. Quod tandem, Torquate, regnum? Consulatus, credo, mei ... quo in magistratu non institutum est a me regnum, sed repressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vero regnum est, et ferri nullo pacto potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchus regnum occupare conatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl> (for which affectare is cited, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 12</bibl>; v. Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">regnum judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">forense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tribuni militum in plebe Romanā regnum exercerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatus crimine regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:189" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum regnum te, Roma, facit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gives thee a sovereign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 692</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40912.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abuteris ad omnia atomorum regno et licentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub regno tibi esse placet omnes animi partes et eas regi consilio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 50.— </sense><sense id="n40912.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">a kingdom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grates tibi ago, summe sol, quod conspicio in meo regno et his tectis P. Cornelium Scipionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fines regni sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(flumen Mulucha) Jugurthae Bocchique regnum disjungebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se patrio regno pulsos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aufidus) Qui regna Dauni praefluit Appuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 26 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbara regna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum caelorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv.
