Jovin. 2, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 11</bibl> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">cerea regna refingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 202</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40912.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40912.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Any place which one possesses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, nisi hic in tuo regno essemus, non tulissem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on your own territories</tr>, <tr>on your own estate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post aliquot mea regna videns, mirabor aristas?</quote> <trans><tr>fields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 476</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna videt pauper Nasamon errantia vento,</quote> <trans><tr>his cottages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:458 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 458 al.</bibl></cit>: haec regna, <hi rend="ital">these realms</hi>, i. e. of the dead, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 417</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40912.8" n="2" level="3"> Regna = reges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:380" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 380</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rego: <entryFree id="n40913" type="main" key="re^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. arg-, argami, to obtain; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)re/gw</foreign> reach after; cf. <pb n="1552" /> <cb n="REGO" /> Sanscr. rāgan; Goth. reiks, king; Germ. Reich and Recht</etym>, <sense id="n40913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to keep straight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from going wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead straight; to guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: guberno, moderor). </sense><sense id="n40913.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus est, qui regit et moderatur et movet id corpus, cui praepositus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus una (navem) regit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera navium velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte ratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">clavum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ventorum regat pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 24), 24: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcet et regit beluam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 556</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:474" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 474</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantia ora (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi impotentes regendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 7</bibl>: taurus ex grege, quem prope litora regebat, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 715</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rege tela per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela per viscera Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 350</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">missum jaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas nusquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regens tenui vestigia filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Daedalium iter lino duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca filo vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diverso flamina tractu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 16, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40913.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">regere fines,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw the boundaries</tr>, <tr>mark out the limits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 10, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 39</bibl> tit. Finium regundorum.—</sense><sense id="n40913.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40913.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus qui omnem hunc mundum regit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli fera munera Mavors regit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:47" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia nostra ita gerito, regito, gubernato, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus animum atque ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi motus (with moderari cupiditates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 834</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me ipse regam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudines principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem arbitratu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque regerentur magis quam regerent casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam regi leges, non regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utroque vorsum rectum est ingenium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem suscepisses juvenem regendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvanum specie obsequii regebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo regere potest, nisi qui et regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 69</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40913.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40913.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have the supremacy over</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quare qui convenit polliceri operam suam rei publicae, cum rem publicam regere nesciant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 27, 43: in iis civitatibus quae ab optimis reguntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 9, 15: illa civitas optimatium arbitrio regi dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilienses per delectos et principes cives summā justitiā reguntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Frisios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populos imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiis Italiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva, quae regis Antium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana, quae silentium regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 51</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">animi partes consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unius potestate regatur salus et aequabilitas et otium civium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ille (Tarquinius) neque suos mores regere poterat neque suorum libidines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberio regente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare rempublicam nisi uno regente non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo regente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:23" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clemens ambitioso imperio regebat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>used his authority to court popular favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40913.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To guide into the right way</hi> one who has erred; <hi rend="ital">to set right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>: non multa peccas, sed si peccas, te regere possum, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 60</bibl> (with corrigere and inflectere): <cit><quote lang="la">errantem regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo, domine, consilio me regas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 19</bibl></cit> (30), 1; cf.: alicujus dubitationem, id. ib 10, 118 (119), 3.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n40913.8" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">P. a. as subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a governor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptus regentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obsequium regentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41</bibl></cit>: clementia regentis, Sen. Clem. <cb n="REGO" /> 1, 22, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">vita regentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excogitare nemo quicquam poterit, quod magis decorum regenti sit quam clementia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 59, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vulgus manant exempla regentum (= -tium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 168</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40913.9" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">led straight along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawn in a straight line</hi> (horizontal or vertical), <hi rend="ital">straight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/s.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n40913.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of horizontal direction: <cit><quote lang="la">pars Remorum recta est (opp. refracta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nil omnino rectā regione viaï declinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 249</bibl></cit> Munro: <cit><quote lang="la">rectā regione iter instituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">India, rectā regione spatiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nostras aedes hic quidem habet rectam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:75:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 75, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">platea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia viarum (opp. iter flexum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus hinc in Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa quae rectis lineis suos ordines servant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto ad Iberum itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua forent pedibus vestigia rectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto grassetur limite miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut rectae acies concurrissent,</quote> <trans><tr>in a straight line</tr>, <tr>line of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (quincunx), in quamcumque partem spectaveris, rectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vos aliud nihil orat, nisi ut rectis oculis hanc urbem sibi intueri liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus adparatus terribilium rectos oculos tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectis oculis gladios micantes videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 76, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:104:24" default="NO">104, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:542" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 542</bibl></cit>.—Of vertical direction: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hae (partes) rursum rectis lineis in caelestem locum subvolent,</quote> <trans><tr>in perpendicular lines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <trans><tr>perpendicular</tr>, <tr>steep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl></cit> (just before: pleraque Alpium arrectiora sunt); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rectae prope rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita jacere talum, ut rectus assistat: qui ita talus erit jactus ut cadet rectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput rectum et secundum naturam (opp. dejectum, supinum), in latus inclinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans><tr>straight</tr>, <tr>erect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Quintia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:86:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 86, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterque Non agit in rectum, sed in orbem curvat eundem,</quote> <trans><tr>does not shape his course directly forward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit ut hostiles in rectum exire cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 327</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus Rectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectior coma,</quote> <trans><tr>smoother</tr>, <tr>straighter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā trabe rectior exstet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectissima linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40913.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40913.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befitting;</hi> opp. to what is false or improper: vobis mentes rectae quae stare solebant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 208 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut rectā viā rem narret ordine omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 28</bibl></cit> (just before: aperte, ita ut res sese habet, narrato); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 6, 11</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Estne hoc, ut dico? <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Rectam instas viam: Ea res est, <hi rend="ital">you</hi>'<hi rend="ital">re on the right way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 39</bibl>: in rectam redire semitam, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectā viā depelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO">10, 1, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:54" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so post-class.: de viā rectā declinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: a rectā viā avertere, Aug. Civ Dei, 12, 17, 2: ad rectum iter retrahere, Hier. in Osee, 2, 8 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:in Mich. 3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Mich. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta consilia dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sint in artibus recta ac prava dijudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 195</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt recta et simplicia laudantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo rectus et secundum naturam enunciatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) recta an ordine permutato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO">9, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Marathonis propugnatores recto sono juravit (opp. flexus vocis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 168</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto ac justo proelio dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectarum cenarum consuetudo,</quote> <trans><tr>a regular</tr>, <tr>formal supper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:69:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 69, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:2" default="NO">7, 20, 2</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:50:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 50, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus recta est (with contenta decore simplici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominibus rectis expendere nummos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on good securities</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: ut natura dedit, sic omnis recta figura, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>,<cb n="REGO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18, 25</bibl> (3, 11, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">absque te esset, ego illum haberem rectum ad ingenium bonum,</quote> <trans><tr>suitable</tr>, <tr>qualified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectum est etiam in illis contentionibus gravitatem retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid verum, quid falsum, quid rectum in oratione pravumve,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter, quam est rectum verumque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit rectum, Nocere facile est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (opp. durum et incomptum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 65</bibl></cit>; (opp. vitiosum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare aliquid a recto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta et vera loquere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sincerely</tr>, <tr>openly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec recta tantum et in nullos flexus recedentia copiose tractaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea plerumque recta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectior divisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid novisti rectius istis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectissima ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40913.13" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40913.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Morally right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lawful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi> (opp. pravus); as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous; uprightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rectitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">honesta res dividitur in rectum et laudabile. Rectum est, quod cum virtute et officio fit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: illud rectum, quod <foreign lang="greek">kato/rqwma</foreign> dicebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam nisi honestum et rectum ab altero postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with honestum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. pravum) neque id Putabit, pravum an rectum siet, quod petet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 14, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:20" default="NO">2, 4, 20</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recta consilia (opp. prava),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rectis (opp. in pravitatibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvo dignoscere rectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens sibi conscia recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem rectumque colebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta ingenia (opp. perversa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni vitā suā quemque a rectā conscientiā traversum unguem non oportet discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus secundis Temporibus dubiisque rectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex consularibus, unus L. Caesar firmus est et rectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir rectus et sanctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatus judicii rectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— Rectum est, with <hi rend="ital">subjective-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectum est gravitatem retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40913.15" n="b" level="4"> In gram.: rectus casus, <hi rend="ital">the nominative case</hi> (because not inflected; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. obliqui casus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:61" default="NO">1, 5, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 4</bibl> et saep.—Hence the <hi rend="ital">adverbs</hi>, </sense><sense id="n40913.16" n="A" level="2"> rectā, </sense><sense id="n40913.17" n="B" level="2"> rectō, </sense><sense id="n40913.18" n="C" level="2"> rectē. </sense><sense id="n40913.19" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectā</orth> (sc. viā). <hi rend="ital">straightway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straightforwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directly</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic ad me rectā habet rectam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ad regem rectā me ducam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu rus hinc ibis? ... rectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius ab subselliis in rostra rectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 18; 40; Auct. B. Hisp. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121 al.</bibl>: tendimus hinc rectā Beneventum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 71</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40913.20" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">straightforwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directly</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">appellationes, quae recto ad principem factae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 611, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40913.21" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n40913.22" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in a straight line</hi> (horizontal or perpendicular), <hi rend="ital">straightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpendicularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uprightly</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o)rqw=s</foreign> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitem bene enodatam deligato recte, flexuosa uti ne siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliae (atomi) declinabunt, aliae suo nutu recte ferentur ... quae (atomi) recte, quae oblique ferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satyri, cum quadrupedes, tum recte currentes, humanā effigie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40913.23" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi> (very freq. in all periods and styles): <cit><quote lang="la">recta et vera loquere, sed neque vere neque recte adhuc Fecisti umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti edepol et recte et bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: si facias recte <pb n="1553" /> <cb n="REGO" /> aut commode, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with commode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte et sapienter facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte atque ordine factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte atque ordine facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 17</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Brisson. Form. II. p. 197: recte ac merito miseriā commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte atque in loco constare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu recte seu pervorse facta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu recte seu perperam facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl></cit>; so (opp. perperam) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte dictum (opp. absurde),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte concludere (opp. vitiose),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte factum (opp. turpiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">recte rationem tenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hercle quin tu recte dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 47</bibl>: recte auguraris de me, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recte judicas de Catone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rectissime quidem judicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demum sciam Recta monuisse, si tu recte caveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:71 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 71 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 49</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">admonere recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis amicis recte res suas narrare,</quote> <trans><tr>properly</tr>, <tr>openly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Epicurus) circumitione quādam deos tollens recte non dubitat divinationem tollere,</quote> <trans><tr>consistently</tr>, <tr>logically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem asservare recte, ne aufugiat,</quote> <trans><tr>duly</tr>, <tr>carefully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui recte dare epistulam,</quote> <trans><tr>correctly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fuit cui recte ad te litteras darem,</quote> <trans><tr>safely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sed habebat ducem Gabinium, quicum quidvis rectissime facere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui suam salutem recte committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recte ambulaverit is, qui hanc epistulam tulit,</quote> <trans><tr>goes as he ought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: tabernaculum recte captum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the prescribed manner</hi> (opp. vitio captum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi recte facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver sacrum non esse recte factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 44</bibl></cit>: procedere recte, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, Enn. ap. Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 37</bibl> (Ann. v. 454 Vahl.): <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Recte valet? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Vivit recte et valet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 11</bibl>, and 14: <cit><quote lang="la">valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud matrem recte est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>she is quite well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">recte esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 16, 4</bibl></cit> (with belle); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 162</bibl> Orell.; cf.: Tullia nostra recte valet ... Praeterea rectissime sunt apud te omnia, Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte sit oculis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivetum recte putare,</quote> <trans><tr>properly</tr>, <tr>advantageously</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet illa recte sub manus succedere,</quote> <trans><tr>well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte cavere,</quote> <trans><tr>to look out well</tr>, <tr>take good care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 72</bibl>; cf.: recte sibi videre, <hi rend="ital">to look out well for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 12</bibl> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos volo consilia vostra recte vortere,</quote> <trans><tr>well</tr>, <tr>happily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vortere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: recte vendere, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a high price</hi> (opp. male), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nec recte dicere, i. e. male, injuriose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec recte loqui alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec recte dicere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply nec recte dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnia alia aetate sapimus rectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi erit rectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectius bella gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possidentem multa vocaveris Recte beatum, rectius occupet Nomen beati, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>. — </sense><sense id="n40913.24" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much</hi>, to strengthen the idea (ante-class.): illasce oves, quā de re agitur, sanas recte esse, uti pecus ovillum, quod recte sanum est, etc., an ancient formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus recte ferax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvus sum recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morata recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneratus recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recte vinctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40913.25" n="c" level="4"> Ellipt., esp. in answers, in colloquial lang., <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently: Thr.</hi> Primum aedis expugnabo. <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Recte. <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Virginem eripiam. <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Probe. <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Male mulcabo ipsam. <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Pulchre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 3</bibl>: quid vos? quo pacto hic? satin recte? (sc. est, agitur, <cb n="REGR" /> valetis, etc.), <hi rend="ital">quite well?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 5, 9</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Satin' salve? dic mihi. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Recte, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 54</bibl>; and: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Quid fit? quid agitur? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Recte. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Optime'st, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40913.26" n="B" level="2"> So, in colloquial lang., freq. like benigne and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kalw=s,</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ka/llista e)/xei,</foreign> as a courteously evasive answer, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s all right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s nothing the matter;</hi> or, in politely declining an offer, <hi rend="ital">nothing is wanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no I thank you: De.</hi> Unde incedis? quid festinas, gnate mi? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Recte pater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Quid es tam tristis? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Recte mater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 20</bibl>; and: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quid tu istic? <hi rend="ital">Syr.</hi> Recte equidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 7</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Quid est? <hi rend="ital">Aes.</hi> Nihil, recte, perge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo numquid velit? Recte inquit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>no</tr>, <tr>nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in an exclamation: clamabit, pulchre! bene! recte!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regradatio: <entryFree id="n40914" type="hapax" key="re^gra^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgrădātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>regrado</etym>, <sense id="n40914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degradation</hi> in rank, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
regrado: <entryFree id="n40915" type="main" key="re^gra^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-grădo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>re-gradus</etym>. <sense id="n40915.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To degrade in rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Johan. Hieros. 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Novel. Theod. 2, 21, 1: usque ad decimum locum regradari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes qui peccaverant regradantur in aedituos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jovin. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40915.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring back into the former order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rearrange as before</hi> (by intercalation), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regredior: <entryFree id="n40916" type="main" key="re^gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come back; to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (class.; syn.: revertor, redeo). </sense><sense id="n40916.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut regredi quam progredi mallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc regredere ab ostio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex itinere in castra regressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18</bibl></cit> (with redituros): <cit><quote lang="la">regressus Tarraconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem regreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Hiberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 22, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Germaniā in Urbem regressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regressus in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regressus domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro (opp. ultro progredi), Auct. B. Afr. 50, 3: inde regressus Cretam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 77</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n40916.2" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to march back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi autem hoc acrius instabant neque regredi nostros patiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim in collis regredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 11, 1</bibl>, and 2.— </sense><sense id="n40916.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40916.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">an in eum annum progredi nemo potuerit edicto, quo praetor alius futurus est: in illum, quo alius praetor fuit, regredietur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regredi infinite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo incepto studioque me ambitio mala detinuerat, eodem regressus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut et digredi ex eo et regredi in id facile possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad formandos animos, id. prooem. § 14: in memoriam regredior audisse me (with redeo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in reorum potestatem regredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40916.5" n="2" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to have recourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad venditorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:21:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 21, § 3</bibl></cit>.?*! <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">regrĕdo</orth>: gradum regredere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 23</bibl> (Trag. v. 13 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
regredo: <entryFree id="n40917" type="main" key="regre^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">regrĕdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. regredior <sense id="n40917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
regressio: <entryFree id="n40918" type="main" key="re^gressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>regredior</etym>, <sense id="n40918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return; a retiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n40918.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vespertina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 227, 17: non incruenta, Front. Princ. Hist. — </sense><sense id="n40918.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, a fig. of rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">repetition</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pa/nodos,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Schem. Lex. 19</bibl> (p. 252 Frotsch.).</sense></entryFree>
regressus: <entryFree id="n40919" type="main" key="re^gressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from regredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40920" type="main" key="re^gressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>regredior</etym>, <sense id="n40920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regress</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40920.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil errat, quod in omni aeternitate conservat progressus et regressus reliquosque motus constantes et ratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regressus non dabat ille viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 34</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus occidimus neque habet Fortuna regressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 413</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 157</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40920.2" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regressus inde in tutum non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:40" default="NO">2, 5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:3:11:3" default="NO">3, 11, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40920.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque locus poenitendi aut regressūs ab irā relictus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est privatis cogitationibus regressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: nullo ad poenitendum <cb n="REGU" /> regressu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul regressum animoso ejus dicto obtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40920.4" n="B" level="2"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a remedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resource</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum adversus venditorem habetis regressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40920.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: ut contra judiciorum varietates superesset artificis regressus ad veniam, Plin. H. N. praef. § 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
regula: <entryFree id="n40921" type="main" key="re_gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straight piece of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi> (class.; cf.: norma, libella). </sense><sense id="n40921.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: atque si id crederemus, non egeremus perpendiculis, non normis, non regulis, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(with linea): perpendiculum, and norma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam ad regulam et libellam exigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:11 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 11 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cum regulā exploraveris aequale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40921.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40921.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A straight staff;</hi> in gen., <hi rend="ital">a stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bar</hi> (of wood or iron): <cit><quote lang="la">quadratas regulas, quattuor patentes digitos, defigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:2" default="NO">6, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:10" default="NO">12, 50, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:594" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 594</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea,</quote> <trans><tr>an ingot of gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josue, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40921.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A measuringrod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regulā, in pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40921.5" n="3" level="3"> In mechanics. </sense><sense id="n40921.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the two cheeks on each side of the channel in which the dart of the catapult lay; also called</hi> bucculae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40921.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The shank of a triglyph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40921.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The disks of an oilpress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si regulis olea prematur, et praelum et suculam et regulas dominum parare oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19, § 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40921.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">example</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formula, praescriptio): fontem omnium bonorum in corpore esse: hanc normam, hanc regulam, hanc praescriptionem esse naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regula, ad quam eorum dirigantur orationes, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regula, quā vera et falsa judicarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:41:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 41, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos studia nostra nostrae naturae regulā metiamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lex est) juris atque injuriae regula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regula totius philosophiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
