D. 1, 16, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravissima consuetudinis regula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritatis regula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium una regula est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendate loquendi regula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad legem ac regulam compositum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locuti sunt ad hanc regulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo regulam, ut talia visa vera judicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assit Regula, peccatis quae poenas irroget aequas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundam regulam nostram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> v. 13, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 16</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> (only late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=142" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 17, 2, § 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1</bibl>, n. 59: <cit><quote lang="la">regulae credendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
regularis: <entryFree id="n40922" type="main" key="re_gu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>regula, I. B. 1.</etym> <sense id="n40922.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a bar</hi>: aes, <hi rend="ital">that can be formed into bars; called also</hi> aes ductile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 20, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40922.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Containing rules for guidance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri regulares, quos diaeteticos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11:145" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11, 145</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgŭlārĭter</orth> (acc. to regula, II.), <hi rend="ital">according to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 898</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita vestigia regulariter recurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regulatim: <entryFree id="n40923" type="main" key="re_gu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id. II.</etym>, <sense id="n40923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">according to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 402</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
regulo: <entryFree id="n40924" type="hapax" key="re_gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regulantur, sive diriguntur eorum virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
regulus: <entryFree id="n40925" type="main" key="re_gu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rex</etym>. <sense id="n40925.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The ruler of a small country</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">duna/sths</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a petty king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chieftain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lord</hi> (freq. in the historians; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cæs. or Cic.): regulos se acceptos in fidem in Hispaniā reges reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cilicum reguli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josue, 13, 3 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40925.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40925.2" n="A" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">the king-bee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40925.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A king</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prince</hi> (cf. rex and regina), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:14:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 14, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40925.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small bird</hi>, Auct. Carm. Phil. 13.—</sense><sense id="n40925.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of serpent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 16, 59, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 23, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 30, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40926" type="main" key="Re_gu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40926.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the</hi> Atilii, among whom was the celebrated<pb n="1554" /> <cb n="REIC" />  consul M. Atilius Regulus, who was taken prisoner by the Carthaginians in the first Punic war, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 4</bibl> and 9 sqq.— </sense><sense id="n40926.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the</hi> Livineii, Auct. B. Afr. 89, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 60, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 17, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40926.3" n="III" level="1"> Another, called by Modestus omnium bipedum nequissimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40926.4" n="IV" level="1"> Aquilius Regulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regusto: <entryFree id="n40927" type="main" key="re^gusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to taste again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n40927.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem suam regustantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regustatum digito terebrare salinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>licked out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40927.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam (laudationem Lollii) legi, volo tamen regustare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to read again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro regusto litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: ille Latinus <foreign lang="greek">a)ttikismo\s</foreign> ex intervallo regustandus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
regyro: <entryFree id="n40928" type="hapax" key="re^gy_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-gȳro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn about again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wheel round;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in Hispaniam regyravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reicio: <entryFree id="n40929" type="main" key="re_i^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-ĭcĭo</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-jĭcĭo</orth>), <itype>rejēci, jectum, 3</itype> (reicis, dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:574" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 574</bibl>; <sense id="n40929.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and likewise reice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and perh. also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; scanned elsewhere throughout rēĭcio, etc.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fling back</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: remitto, retorqueo). </sense><sense id="n40929.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40929.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n40929.3" n="a" level="4"> Of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">imago nostros oculos rejecta revisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 285</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 107</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 570</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: tunicam reicere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fling back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fling over the shoulder</hi> (whereas abicere is to throw off, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl>), Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 69</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">togam in umerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:140" default="NO">140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam a sinistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam ab umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictum ex umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex umeris' vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de corpore vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl> Burm.: <cit><quote lang="la">sagulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit> (3, 17), 13: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:81 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 81 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ore colubras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum circum caput neglegenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: manibus ad tergum rejectis, <hi rend="ital">thrown back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, Asin. Pol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus post terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 11, § 45</bibl></cit>: scutum, <hi rend="ital">to throw over one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s back</hi> (in flight), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl>; Galb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut janua in publicum reiceretur,</quote> <trans><tr>might be thrown back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigata membra rejecit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stretched on the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluit ... Reicere Alcides a se mea pectora,</quote> <trans><tr>to push back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum e gremio suo,</quote> <trans><tr>to fling away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem ore,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast up</tr>, <tr>vomit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 82, § 131</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 191" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 191</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos Rutulorum reicit arvis,</quote> <trans><tr>turns away</tr>, <tr>averts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (vocum) solidis adlisa locis rejecta sonorem Reddit,</quote> <trans><tr>echoed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 570</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40929.4" n="b" level="4"> Of living objects, <hi rend="ital">to drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi> (so in gen. not found in class. prose authors): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bubilem reicere (boves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascentes a flumine capellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in postremam aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to place in the rear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40929.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Reicere se, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">again;</hi> or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fling one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">tum illa Rejecit se in eum,</quote> <trans><tr>flung herself into his arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in gremium tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in grabatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cubile rejectus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 103, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigata membra rejecit,</quote> <trans><tr>leaned back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40929.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40929.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to force back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi> the enemy (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repello, reprimo, refuto): eos, qui eruptionem fecerant, in urbem reiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui in oppidum rejecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusci rejecti armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Antiocheā hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia adversariorum Calydone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 35</bibl></cit> (where, however, as <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 46</bibl>, the MSS. vacillate between rejecti and dejecti; v. Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).— </sense><sense id="n40929.8" n="2" level="3"> Nautical t. t.: reici, <hi rend="ital">to be driven back</hi> by a storm (while deferri or deici signifies to be cast away, and eici to be thrown on the shore, stranded; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 19, 2</bibl> Drak.): naves tempestate rejectas eodem, unde erant profectae,<cb n="REIN" />  revertisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Leucopetrā profectus ... rejectus sum austro vehementi ad eandem Leucopetram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 30, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin reflantibus ventis reiciemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n40929.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40929.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cast off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te socordiam omnem reice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: abs te religionem, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 430 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam ut a nobis ratio verissima longe reiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hanc proscriptionem) nisi hoc judicio a vobis reicitis et aspernamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his reicientur plagae balistarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedum contactum a casto corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum et audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:770" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 770</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">minas Hannibalis retrorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in Verrinis) facilius quod reici quam quod adici possit invenient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40929.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40929.12" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to reject contemptuously; to refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise;</hi> esp. of a lover, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan nos reiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem omnem istam disputationem rejecisse et tantum de vitā et moribus solitum esse quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refutetur ac reiciatur ille clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Ennii Medeam spernat aut reiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an appeal to the Senate: quae cum rejecta relatio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens dolor consolationes reicit ac refugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bona deligenda et reicienda contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(vulgares reïce taedas, deligere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rejectā praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones, Auct. B. Alex. 39: rejecit dona nocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40929.13" n="b" level="4"> In jurid. lang.: judices reicere, <hi rend="ital">to set aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">challenge peremptorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi> the judges appointed by lot: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex CXXV. judicibus quinque et LXX. reus reiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 13, § 32</bibl>; 2, 3, 59, § 146; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40929.14" n="c" level="4"> In the philosoph. lang. of the Stoics: reicienda and rejecta (as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)poprohgme/na</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">rejectable things</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">evils to be rejected</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:26:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 26, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 37</bibl>; cf. rejectaneus.— </sense><sense id="n40929.15" n="2" level="3"> With a designation of the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to refer to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make over to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remand to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ipsam te epistulam reicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc gregem vos Sullam reicietis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 77</bibl></cit> (with transferre).— </sense><sense id="n40929.16" n="b" level="4"> Publicists' t. t.: reicere aliquid or aliquem ad senatum (consules, populum, pontifices, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to refer a matter</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the one whom it concerns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to some other officer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authorized body</hi> (esp. freq. in Liv.; v. the passages in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22, 5</bibl> Drak.): <cit><quote lang="la">totam rem ad Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus a se rem ad populum rejecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab tribunis ad senatum res est rejecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 29</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad pontificum collegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 16</bibl></cit>; so, rem ad pontifices, Ver. Flac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu hoc animo esse debes, ut nihil huc reicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">legati ab senatu rejecti ad populum, deos rogaverunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 2</bibl>; 39, 3.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni appellati ad senatum rejecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:32" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n40929.17" n="c" level="4"> With respect to time, <hi rend="ital">to put off to a later period</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">a Kal. Febr. legationes in Idus Febr. reiciebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua in mensem Januarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente abs te in mensem Quintilem rejecti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40929.18" n="d" level="4"> Reicere se aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to fling one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self on a thing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">apply one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to it</hi> (very rare): crede mihi, Caesarem ... maximum beneficium te sibi dedisse judicaturum, si huc te reicis, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>, A, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
reiculus: <entryFree id="n40930" type="main" key="re_i^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēĭcŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rējĭcŭlus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reicio</etym>; in econom. lang., <sense id="n40930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is to be rejected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40930.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n40930.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spent uselessly</tr>, <tr>lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reinvito: <entryFree id="n40931" type="main" key="re^invi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-invīto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to invite again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in return</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 14, 12</bibl>. <cb n="RELA" /></sense></entryFree>
reiteratio: <entryFree id="n40932" type="spur" key="re^i^te^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-ĭtĕrātĭo</orth>, a false read. for iteratione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 35</bibl>; v. Spald. ad h. l.</entryFree>
reitero: <entryFree id="n40933" type="main" key="re^i^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-ĭtĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reiterate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferinos mugitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
rejectaneus: <entryFree id="n40934" type="main" key="re_jecta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējectānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reicio</etym>, <sense id="n40934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is to be rejected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejectable</hi> (a word formed by Cic. as a philosoph. t. t.): morbum, egestatem, dolorem non appello mala, sed si libet, rejectanea (as a transl. of the Stoic <foreign lang="greek">a)poprohgme/na</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72</bibl> (cf. rejecta, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 52</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and reicienda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26, 78</bibl></cit>; and reducta, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
rejectatio: <entryFree id="n40935" type="hapax" key="re_jecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rejecto</etym>, <sense id="n40935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing back repeatedly</hi> (late Lat. for rejectio): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
rejectio: <entryFree id="n40936" type="main" key="re_jecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reicio</etym>, <sense id="n40936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throwing away.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n40936.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>throwing up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 76, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 31, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40936.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rejecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re jection</hi> (so in good prose, esp. freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n40936.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">selectio et item rejectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si civi Romano licet esse Gaditanum, sive exilio, sive postliminio, sive rejectione hujus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 12, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40936.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40936.5" n="1" level="3"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a challenging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejection</hi> of a judge: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 15, 36</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rejectione interpositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 33, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40936.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere, quicquid dici potest, et velut rejectione factā ad optimum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: eruditorum, Plin. H. N. praef. § 7.— </sense><sense id="n40936.7" n="2" level="3"> Rhet. t. t. </sense><sense id="n40936.8" n="a" level="4"> In alium, <hi rend="ital">a shifting off from one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 204</bibl> (al. trajectio; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>); cited also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40936.9" n="b" level="4"> = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)podi/wcis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the setting aside</hi> of considerations which are not pertinent, Jul. Rufin. Schem. Lex. § 12.</sense></entryFree>
rejecto: <entryFree id="n40937" type="main" key="re_jecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40937.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast back</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">montes Icti rejectant voces ad sidera mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 328</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:421" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 421</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseum Alpinum rejectavit,</quote> <trans><tr>cast up</tr>, <tr>vomited</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Anton. 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40937.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw away again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:722" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 722</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rejectus: <entryFree id="n40938" type="main" key="re_jectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from reicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40939" type="hapax" key="re_jectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reicio</etym>, <sense id="n40939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown portion of the hinder part of a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:36" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rejicio: <entryFree id="n40940" type="main" key="re_ji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rējĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, v. reicio.</entryFree>
relabor: <entryFree id="n40941" type="main" key="re^la_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glide back; to sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall back</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n40941.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix oculos tollens iterumque relabens, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>sinking back upon the couch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Orpheus) flexit amans oculos et protinus illa (Eurydice) relapsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscendere summas antennas prensoque rudente relabi,</quote> <trans><tr>to slide down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:616" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinus relabere nostros,</quote> <trans><tr>return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 95</bibl></cit>: retrahitque pedem simul unda relabens, <hi rend="ital">flowing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreating</hi>, * Verg A. 10, 307; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis neget arduis Pronos relabi posse rivos Montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flecte ratem, Theseu, versoque relabere vento,</quote> <trans><tr>sail back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mare) relabens terram naturae suae reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberim) relabentem secuta est aedificiorum et hominum strages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relabente aestu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40941.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall back; to relapse; to return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in Aristippi furtim praecepta relabor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc mens et sonus Relapsus atque notus in vultus honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relambo: <entryFree id="n40942" type="main" key="re^lambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lambo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick again</hi>, Sed. 4, 248.</sense></entryFree>
relanguesco: <entryFree id="n40943" type="main" key="re^languesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-languesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink down fainting; to grow languid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faint</hi> (class. but rare). </sense><sense id="n40943.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(soror) Imposito fratri moribunda relanguit ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 291</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40943.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the wind, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 8, 3</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a star,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow dim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 51, § 134</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40943.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become enfeebled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relax</hi>: quod iis rebus relanguescere animos eorum et remitti virtutem existimarent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl>: quod autem relanguisse se dicit, <hi rend="ital">that he has relaxed</hi> (in his enmity), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animo relanguit ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut taedio impetus relanguescat regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 44</bibl></cit> (relanguerat, v. l. for elanguerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">si prima indignatio relanguescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relatio: <entryFree id="n40944" type="main" key="re^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>refero</etym>, <sense id="n40944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing back.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n40944.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: membranae ut juvant aciem, ita crebrā relatione, quoad intinguntur calami, morantur manum, <hi rend="ital">through the frequent carrying of the</hi> <pb n="1555" /> <cb n="RELA" /> <hi rend="ital">hand back to the inkstand</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">by often stopping to dip the pen in the ink</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40944.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40944.3" n="A" level="2"> In law t. t., <hi rend="ital">a throwing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retorting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">relatio criminis, est cum ideo jure factum dicitur, quod aliquis ante injuriā lacessierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisjurandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:34" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40944.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40944.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repaying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 74, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40944.6" n="2" level="3"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">a report; a proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis audivit non modo actionem aliquam aut relationem, sed vocem omnino aut querellam tuam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relatio illa salutaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relationem approbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare in aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relationi intercedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit> al.: jus quartae relationis, <hi rend="ital">the right accorded to the emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without being consul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of making communications in the Senate</hi> (this right was simply jus relationis; <cit><quote lang="la">tertiae, quartae, etc., denote the number of subjects he might introduce at each meeting, which varied at different periods),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> — Hence, </sense><sense id="n40944.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relation</hi> (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dictorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ab Scythis gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of military reports to the general-in-chief or emperor: addens quaedam relationibus supervacua, quas subinde dimittebat ad principem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 1, 10</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40944.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorical figure</hi> mentioned by Cicero, of the nature of which Quintilian was ignorant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 97</bibl>: epanaphora est relatio; quotiens per singula membra eadem pars orationis repetitur, hoc modo: Verres calumniatores apponebat, Verres de causā cognoscebat; <cit><quote lang="la">Verres pronunciabat?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the repetition of a word for rhetorical effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 534 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40944.9" n="4" level="3"> In philos. and gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">reference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quoque est ex relatione ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relatione factā non ad id,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relative: <entryFree id="n40945" type="main" key="re^la_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. relativus <sense id="n40945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
relativus: <entryFree id="n40946" type="main" key="re^la_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>refero</etym>, <sense id="n40946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having reference</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">referring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relative</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In gram.: pronomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1063 sq.</bibl></cit> P.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">relatively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinus et amicus relative dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 5:71" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 5, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relator: <entryFree id="n40947" type="main" key="re^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40947.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposer</hi>, in public deliberations: Lentulo consule relatore, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>, A, § 2. — </sense><sense id="n40947.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A relater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrator</hi>, in gen., Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:471" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2 al.</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n40947.2" n="II" level="1"> RELATOR AVCTIONVM, <hi rend="ital">a reporter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recorder of public auctions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3238</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
relatoria: <entryFree id="n40948" type="hapax" key="re^la_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receipt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquittance</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
relatrix: <entryFree id="n40949" type="main" key="re^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>relator</etym>, <sense id="n40949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female teller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrator</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Carm. 9, 17</bibl> Duker.</sense></entryFree>
relatus: <entryFree id="n40950" type="main" key="re^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from refero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40951" type="main" key="re^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>refero</etym>. <sense id="n40951.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An official report</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abnuentibus consulibus eā de re relatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40951.1" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a narration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recital</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina, quorum relatu, quem baritum vocant, accendunt animos,</quote> <trans><tr>with the delivery of which</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilium relatu commendationem parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:64" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
relaxatio: <entryFree id="n40952" type="main" key="re^laxa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlaxātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>relaxo, trop.</etym>, <sense id="n40952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an easing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxation</hi> (Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">verum otii fructus est non contentio animi sed relaxatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel loci mutatio vel animi relaxatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est ista relaxatio, cum (sc. doloris),</quote> <trans><tr>mitigation</tr>, <tr>alleviation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relaxator: <entryFree id="n40953" type="hapax" key="re^laxa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlaxātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>relaxo</etym>, <sense id="n40953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loosener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opener</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:38:221" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 38, 221</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relaxo: <entryFree id="n40954" type="main" key="re^laxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-laxo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">widen again; to unloose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (class.; cf.: solvo, libero). </sense><sense id="n40954.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus tum astringitur, tum relaxatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum astringentibus se intestinis tum relaxantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densa relaxare (opp. rara densare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolvunt nodos omnes et vincla relaxant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 356</bibl></cit>: tunicarum vincula, <cb n="RELE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:321" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 321</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nodos (sc. aquaï),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 878</bibl></cit> (with exsolvere glaciem); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fontibus ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecos fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebas,</quote> <trans><tr>to loosen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:27:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias et caeca Spiramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 903" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa bracchia,</quote> <trans><tr>to spread out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <trans><tr>to unbend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 322" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quae (aedificia) sunt vetustate sublapsa, relaxentur in melius,</quote> <trans><tr>restored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 70</bibl></cit> (75), 1 Keil (al. reparentur).— </sense><sense id="n40954.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soften</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage; to cheer up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enliven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relax</hi> (a favorite word of Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">relevo, recreo, mitigo): animos doctrinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu a contentionibus cottidie relaxes aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: quaero enim non quibus intendam rebus animam, sed quibus relaxem, ac remittam, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 329, 7</bibl>, and 383, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">constructio verborum tum conjunctionibus copuletur, tum dissolutionibus relaxetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater nimis indulgens, quicquid ego astrinxi, relaxat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus somno relaxatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 48, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">relaxare animos et dare se jucunditati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex pristino sermone relaxarentur animi omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxiferas curas requiete, id. poët. Div. 1, 13, 22: (risus) tristitiam ac severitatem mitigat et relaxat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristem vultum relaxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, with this, cf.: relaxato in hilaritatem vultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nocturna quidem quiete diurnum laborem relaxante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: mores aetas lasciva relaxat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">makes dissolute</hi>, Claud. Prob. et Olybr. 153: <cit><quote lang="la">(animi) cum se plane corporis vinculis relaxaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 22, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 330</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se occupationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a nimiā necessitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: homines quamvis in turbidis rebus sint, tamen interdum animis relaxantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insani cum relaxentur,</quote> <trans><tr>when they come to themselves</tr>, <tr>when the attack abates</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: (dolor) si longus, levis; <cit><quote lang="la">dat enim intervalla et relaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relectio: <entryFree id="n40955" type="main" key="re^lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>re-lego</etym>, <sense id="n40955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reperusal</hi> (late Lat.), Facund. Defens. 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
relectus: <entryFree id="n40956" type="main" key="re^lectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. relego.</entryFree>
relegatio: <entryFree id="n40957" type="main" key="re^le_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlēgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. relego</etym>. <sense id="n40957.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sending away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relegation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque amandatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; v. 1. relego, I. A. 2.—</sense><sense id="n40957.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bequest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">legacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:4:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 4, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relego: <entryFree id="n40958" type="main" key="re^le_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40958.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To send away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out of the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (class.; in class. prose usually with an odious accessory meaning; syn. amando). </sense><sense id="n40958.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40958.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(L. Manlium tribunus plebis) criminabatur, quod Titum filium ab hominibus relegasset et ruri habitare jussisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filium in praedia rustica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rejecti et relegati longe ab ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul Europā in ultima orientis relegati senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relegatos in ultimum paene rerum humanarum terminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives tam procul ab domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a republicā sub honorificentissimo ministerii titulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in aliā insulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me vel extremos Numidarum in agros Classe releget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros procul atque in sola relegant Pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 212</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terris gens relegata ultimis, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20: Trivia Hippolytum ... nymphae Egeriae nemorique relegat,</quote> <trans><tr>consigns him to Egeria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 775</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40958.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a locality, <hi rend="ital">to place at a distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taprobane extra orbem a naturā relegata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 250</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40958.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., a publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to send into exile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relegate;</hi> said of banishment by which a person was sent only a certain distance from Rome, and usually for a limited time, without suffering a capitis deminutio (cf. deportatio and exilium): <cit><quote lang="la">relegatus, non exsul, dicor in illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:137" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 13, 40</bibl>: (consul) L. Lamiam ... in concione relegavit, <cb n="RELE" /> edixitque, ut ab urbe abesset millia passuum ducenta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcus Piso in decem annos relegatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse quosdam novo exemplo relegavit, ut ultra lapidem tertium vetaret egredi ab Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo eorum relegatus in exilium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites relegatos prope in exilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Karthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Circeios in perpetuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in decem annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 86</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40958.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to send away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem ille sedens Samnitium dona relegaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>had sent back</tr>, <tr>rejected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 32</bibl></cit> Moser (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiati Samnites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 55</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ambitione relegatā,</quote> <trans><tr>put aside</tr>, <tr>apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 324</bibl></cit> (dimoveam, removeam, Schol.): <cit><quote lang="la">inimicas vitiis artes non odio magis quam reverentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40958.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with a specification of the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to refer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impute</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen ego in plerisque eorum obstringam fidem meam potiusque ad auctores relegabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totamque ad solos audito res relegāsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem rectae honestaeque vitae ad philosophos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">10: mala ad crimen fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 13; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64:2" default="NO">2, 64, 2</bibl> Ruhnk.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to ascribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40958.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To refer</hi> to a book or an author: <cit><quote lang="la">ad auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 5</bibl>, delegare).— </sense><sense id="n40958.8" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to bequeath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, as an inheritance: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:4:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 4, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:5:8" default="NO">23, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
