<entryFree id="n40959" type="main" key="re^le^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĕgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40959.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gather together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collect again</hi> (almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): janua difficilis filo est inventa relecto, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by the thread</hi> (of Ariadne) <hi rend="ital">wound up again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(abies) docilis relegi, docilisque relinqui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be drawn back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:237" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses decem a coactore releget (pecuniam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 150, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40959.1" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of localities, <hi rend="ital">to travel over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to traverse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sail over again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hellespontiacas illa (navis) relegit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressi relegunt campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:121" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 4:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 5, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 572" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter caelum (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia cursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1004</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In prose: relegit Asiam,</quote> <trans><tr>again coasts along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex cum suis dumeta relegens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relegens margines lacus Brigantiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40959.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over again</hi> in reading, in speech, or in thought, <hi rend="ital">to read</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relate again</hi>, = retractare (rarely in prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Trojani belli scriptorem Praeneste relegi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 717 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui librum,</quote> <trans><tr>to read aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nostris releges quemcunque libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:29:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 29, 9</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde relegentes inveniunt, ubi posuerint (verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum relegunt suos sermone labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia, quae ad cultum deorum pertinerent, diligenter retractarent et tamquam relegerent, sunt dicti religiosi ex relegendo, ut elegantes ex eligendo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>.—Acc to this last passage is to be explained: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭ-gens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">revering the gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious</hi>: religentem esse oportet, religiosumst nefas, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
relentesco: <entryFree id="n40960" type="hapax" key="re^lentesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lentesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow slack again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slacken;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">amor relentescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relevamen: <entryFree id="n40961" type="hapax" key="re^le^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĕvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>relevo</etym>, <sense id="n40961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lightening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 440</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relevatio: <entryFree id="n40962" type="main" key="re^le^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĕvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40962.0" n="I" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">e)naiw/rhma</foreign> (Hippoc.), <hi rend="ital">scum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut urina nullam faciat relevationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:55" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 55</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40962.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lightening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relief</hi> (postclass. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (opp. gravatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:96" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 96</bibl>; Octav. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
relevo: <entryFree id="n40963" type="main" key="re^le^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĕvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40963.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi> (very rare, and almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: reficio, recreo, mitigo). </sense><sense id="n40963.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">e terra corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cubitum membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40963.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: nec sic mea fata premuntur, Ut nequeam relevare caput, <pb n="1556" /> <cb n="RELI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 268</bibl> Corte; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte relevet manum suam a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: eos qui oppressi fuerant relevans, id. Job, 12, 21.— </sense><sense id="n40963.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40963.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam graviorem pellectione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: vimina curva favi (i. e. exonerare), Cv. R. Am. 186.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic unquam longā relevere catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimo ut relevere labore Utque marem parias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>may be delivered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 675</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40963.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from</hi> any evil; or, <hi rend="ital">to alleviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi> the evil itself; <hi rend="ital">to ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">console</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbimur ... curā et metu esse relevati, periculum autem residebit ... Ut saepe homines aegri morbo gravi ... si aquam gelidam biberint, primo relevari videntur ... sic hic morbus, qui est in re publicā, relevatus istius poenā, vehementius vivis reliquis ingravescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum molestiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit> (with recreata): <cit><quote lang="la">aegrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora sicca mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra sedili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens a cura relevata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanos tertiā mercedum parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me relevares,</quote> <trans><tr>might comfort</tr>, <tr>console me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et illic animum jam relevaris, quae dolore ac miseria Tabescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia (pupilla) videtur in ceteris litis speciebus relevata fuisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have been restored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">With things as objects: ut cibi satietas et fastidium aut subamara aliquā re relevatur aut dulci mitigatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad relevandos castrenses sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem casum misericordiā hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium omnium laboremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:19:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requie laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:815" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 815</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 697</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliceor: <entryFree id="n40964" type="main" key="re^li^ce^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĭcĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bid less at an auction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl> Orell. (but the better reading is se liceatur, Bait. v. Heine ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
relicinus: <entryFree id="n40965" type="main" key="re^li^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curled backwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi> (App.); <cit><quote lang="la">comā relicinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 341, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>open</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 344, 19.</sense></entryFree>
relictio: <entryFree id="n40966" type="main" key="re^licti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>relinquo</etym>, <sense id="n40966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaving behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a forsaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperatio desperationis ac relictionis rei publicae (just before, relinques patriam?),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictionem proditionemque consulis sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter argenti vivi relictionem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>because of its separation from it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relictor: <entryFree id="n40967" type="main" key="re^lictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who abandons</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disregards</hi> (late Lat.): deus voluntatum bonarum adjutor, malarum autem relictor, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 26.</sense></entryFree>
relictus: <entryFree id="n40968" type="main" key="re^lictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from relinquo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40969" type="hapax" key="re^lictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>relinquo</etym>, <sense id="n40969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forsaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut labor virilis exercendique corporis studium, relictui sit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be abandoned</tr>, <tr>neglected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relicuus: <entryFree id="n40970" type="main" key="re^li^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. reliquus.</entryFree>
relido: <entryFree id="n40971" type="main" key="re^li_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-līdo</orth>, no <sense id="n40971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laedo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strike back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n40971.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: relisā fronte lignum dissilit, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 9, 47: <cit><quote lang="la">alapis relisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Apoth. 162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoth. 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Fab. 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n40971.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae firmata probant aut infirmata relidunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
religamen: <entryFree id="n40972" type="hapax" key="re^li^ga_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>religo</etym>, <sense id="n40972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 358</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
religatio: <entryFree id="n40973" type="hapax" key="re^li^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tying up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religatio et propagatio vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
religens: <entryFree id="n40974" type="main" key="re^li^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. 2. <itype>relego</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
religio: <entryFree id="n40975" type="main" key="re^li^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgĭo</orth> (in poetry also <orth extent="full" lang="la">rellĭgĭo</orth>, to lengthen the first syllable), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Concerning the etymology of this word, various opinions were prevalent among the ancients. Cicero (N. D. 2, 28, 72) derives it from relĕgere, an etymology favored by the verse cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>, religentem esse oportet, religiosum nefas; whereas Servius (ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 349</bibl>), Lactantius (4, 28), Augustine (Retract. 1, 13), al., assume religare as the primitive, and for this derivation Lactantius cites the expression of Lucretius (1, 931; 4, 7): religionum nodis animos exsolvere. Modern etymologists mostly agree <cb n="RELI" /> with this latter view, assuming as root lig, to bind, whence also lic-tor, lex, and ligare; hence, religio sometimes means the same as obligatio; v. Corss. Aussprache, 1, 444 sq.; cf. Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 109</bibl>.</etym> <sense id="n40975.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Reverence for God</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the gods</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the fear of God</hi>, connected with a careful pondering of divine things; <hi rend="ital">piety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religion</hi>, both pure inward piety and that which is manifested in religious rites and ceremonies; <cit><quote lang="la">hence the rites and ceremonies, as well as the entire system of religion and worship, the res divinae or sacrae, were frequently called religio or religiones (cf. our use of the word religion): qui omnia, quae ad cultum deorum pertinerent, diligenter retractarent et tamquam relegerent, sunt dicti religiosi ex relegendo, ut elegantes ex elegendo, tamquam a diligendo diligentes, ex intellegendo intellegentes: his enim in verbis omnibus inest vis legendi eadem, quae in religioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religione id est cultu deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio est, quae superioris cujusdam naturae (quam divinam vocant) curam caerimoniamque affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompilius) animos ardentes consuetudine et cupiditate bellandi religionum caeremoniis mitigavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with which cf.: illa diuturna pax Numae mater huic urbi juris et religionis fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de auguriis, responsis, religione denique omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde enim pietas? aut a quibus religio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a pietate, religione deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum sententiae omnium non modo superstitionem tollunt, in quā inest timor inanis deorum, sed etiam religionem, quae deorum cultu pio continetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim istas (Democriti) imagines ... aut cultu aut religione dignas judicare?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animus cultum deorum et puram religionem susceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Cereris summa majores nostri religione confici caerimoniaque voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus erant omnia, quae sceleri propiora sunt quam religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero superstitione tollenda religio tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 23, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medemini religioni sociorum, judices, conservate vestram. Neque enim haec externa vobis est religio (sc. Cereris) neque aliena, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istorum religio sacrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 8</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">18: religio deorum immortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per deos immortales! eos ipsos, de quorum religione jam diu dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio divum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira quaedam totā Siciliā privatim ac publice religio est Cereris Hennensis . . . quantam esse religionem convenit eorum, apud quos eam (Cererem) natam esse constat? ... tanta erit enim auctoritas illius religionis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 45</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">99: qui (Mercurius) apud eos summā religione coleretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 39</bibl></cit>, § 84; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 39</bibl>, § 85; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 4, 44, § 96: (simulacrum Dianae) translatum Carthaginem locum tantum hominesque mutarat: religionem quidem pristinam conservabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>, § 72; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of the same,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">78: fanum Junonis tantā religione semper fuit, ut ... semper inviolatum sanctumque fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>enjoyed such honor</tr>, <tr>was held in such reverence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 46</bibl></cit>, § 103; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 4, 58, § 129: hac (panacea) evulsā scrobem repleri vario genere frugum religio est,</quote> <trans><tr>is a religious custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 11, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et obrui tales religio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 5, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (barbari) ignari totius negotii ac religionis,</quote> <trans><tr>of religious belief</tr>, <tr>of religion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venit mihi fani, loci, religionis illius in mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">110: de religione queri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>, § 113.—In late and eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a religious ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceremony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est ista religio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista est religio victimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">expertes religionum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in bello religionum et consuetudinis jura continent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus (rebus) etiam oculos cohibere te religionum jura cogebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: religiones expiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae (nationes) pro religionibus suis bella suscipiunt, istae contra omnium religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: Druides religiones interpretantur, <hi rend="ital">religious matters</hi>, <cb n="RELI" /> <hi rend="ital">religion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia morum ac religionum ejus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas religionibus dedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:74:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 74, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberum a religionibus matutinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40975.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40975.2" n="A" level="2"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">conscientiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulousness</hi> arising from religion, <hi rend="ital">religious scruples</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scruples of conscience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious awe</hi>, etc. (cf. sanctimonia): <cit><quote lang="la">refrenatus religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppressa gravi sub religione vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese cum summā religione, tum summo metu legum et judiciorum teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam non metus, non religio contineret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: memini perturbari exercitum nostrum religione et metu, quod serenā nocte subito candens et plena luna defecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā religione obstricta tota provincia est, tanta superstitio ex istius facto mentes omnium Siculorum occupavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obstrinxisti religione populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitatis litteris oblata religio Cornuto est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad oblatam aliquam religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recordabantur, quam parvulae saepe causae vel falsae suspicionis vel terroris repentini vel objectae religionis magna detrimenta intulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicere religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inicere religionem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ne quid Catulus attulerit religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchus cum rem illam in religionem populo venisse sentiret, ad senatum retulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eam rem habuit religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae religio C. Mario non fuerat, quo minus C. Glauciam praetorem occideret, eā nos religione in privato P. Lentulo puniendo liberaremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc quoque, ne confestim bellum indiceretur, religio obstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ibi quoque religio obstaret, ne, etc. . . augures consulti eam religionem eximere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plenā religione civitas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse mihi, religio'st dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut velut numine aliquo defensa castra oppugnare iterum, religio fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivos deducere nulla Religio vetuit (with fas et jura sinunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla mihi Religio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā religione, ut scelus tegat, posse constrin gi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam religio ceperit ulterius quicquam eo die conandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">movendi inde thesauros incussa erat religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio fuit, denegare nolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: non demunt animis curas ac religiones Persarum montes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 379, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis Religionum animum nodis exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 932</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionibus atque minis obsistere vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique novas sibi ex loco religiones fingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio est omnis Gallorum admodum dedita religionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionibus impediri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenis religionum animis, prodigia insuper nunciata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus locus non religionum deorumque est plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifices flaminesque neglegentiores publicarum religionum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 52, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40975.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (<hi rend="ital">effect. pro causā</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a religious offence</hi>, giving rise to scruples of conscience: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si profectus non esset, nullā tamen mendacii religione obstrictus videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberaret religione templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se domumque religione exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexpiabiles religiones in rem publicam inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40975.4" n="c" level="4"> In partic.: religio jurisjurandi, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulousness in the fulfilment of an oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the obligation of an oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plighted faith</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religione jurisjurandi ac metu deorum in testimoniis dicendis commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jurisjurandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Achaeos religione obstringerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:11" default="NO">18, 6, 11</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna proelia esse vitanda, quod perterritus miles in civili dissensione timori magis quam religioni consulere consuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40975.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a strict scrupulousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punctiliousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactness</hi>, etc.: Atheniensium semper fuit prudens sincerumque judicium, nihil ut possent nisi incorruptum audire et elegans. Eorum religioni cum serviret orator, nullum verbum insolens,<pb n="1557" /> <cb n="RELI" />  nullum odiosum ponere audebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:283" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide et religione vitae defendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propter fidem et religionem judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">testimoniorum religionem et fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sine ullā religione ac fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin est in me ratio rei publicae, religio privati officii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio in consilio dando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus facta ad antiquae religionis rationem exquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas est religionem decipi judicantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40975.6" n="B" level="2"> Object. </sense><sense id="n40975.7" n="1" level="3"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">the holiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacredness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity</hi> inhering in any religious object (a deity, temple, utensils, etc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas): quae (fortissimorum civium mentes) mihi videntur ex hominum vitā ad deorum religionem et sanctimoniam demigrasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter singularem ejus fani religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sacerdotibus tanta offusa oculis animoque religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum religio pavidos terrebat agrestes Dira loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 349</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40975.8" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an object of religious veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacred place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno tempore Agrigentini beneficium Africani (sc. signum Apollinis), religionem domesticam, ornamentum urbis, etc. . . . requirebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem restituere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 36</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">80: sacrorum omnium et religionum hostis praedoque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praedo religionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">95: quem tibi deum tantis eorum religionibus violatis auxilio futurum putas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>, § 78; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est sceleris, quod religiones maximas violavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>, § 88.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae religio aut quae machina belli, of the Trojan horse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 151</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40975.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A system of religious belief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a religion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Christiana,</quote> <trans><tr>Christianity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Leo M. Serm. 66, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christianam religionem absolutam et simplicem anili superstitione confundens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
religiose: <entryFree id="n40976" type="main" key="re^li^gi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. religiosus <sense id="n40976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
religiositas: <entryFree id="n40977" type="main" key="re^li^gio_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgiōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>religiosus</etym>, <sense id="n40977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reverence for God</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the gods</hi>), <hi rend="ital">religiousness</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
religiosulus: <entryFree id="n40978" type="hapax" key="re^li^gi^o_su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgĭōsŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">religious little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat religious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Ruf. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
religiosus: <entryFree id="n40979" type="main" key="re^li^gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭgĭōsus</orth> (in the poets also <orth extent="full" lang="la">rellig-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>religio</etym>, <sense id="n40979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reverencing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fearing God</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the gods</hi>), <hi rend="ital">pious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia quae ad cultum deorum pertinerent, diligenter retractarent et tamquam relegerent, sunt dicti religiosi ex relegendo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit> (cf. religio <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">religiosi dicuntur, qui faciendarum praetermittendarumque rerum divinarum secundum morem civitatis delectum habent, nec se superstitionibus implicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=289:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 289, 15</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā sancti et religiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asotos ita non religiosos ut edant de patellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si magis religiosa fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri majores, religiosissimi mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuis religiosa jura tribuere,</quote> <trans><tr>religious rites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores justi, integri, religiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 184</bibl></cit>: amicitiae religiosā quādam necessitudine imbutae, quint. 1, 2, 20: hominem occidere religiosissimum erat, <hi rend="ital">was a thing exceedingly pious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pleasing to the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 4, § 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui nomine quoque consalutare religiosius putant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei, viri religiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40979.1" n="b" level="4"> Eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the clergy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clerical</hi> (opp. saecularis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Avar. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40979.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to religio, II.). </sense><sense id="n40979.3" n="A" level="2"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">religiously considerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas religiosa, in principiis maxime novorum bellorum . . . ne quid praetermitteretur, quod aliquando factum esset. ludos Jovi donumque vovere consulem jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hos quoque dies abstinent terrenis operibus religiosiores agricolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:98" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:62" default="NO">11, 3, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem campi fructum quia religiosum erat consumere,</quote> <trans><tr>was a matter of religious scruple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52</bibl>; <cb n="RELI" /> 6, 27; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosum est, quod jurati legibus judicarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40979.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Overscrupulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superstitious</hi> (rare and only ante-class.): religentem esse oportet, religiosum nefas, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis incultior, religiosior, desertior? Cato ap. Fest. s. v. repulsior, p. 236: ut stultae et miserae sumus Religiosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40979.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">scrupulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosus est non modo deorum sanctitatem magni aestimans, sed etiam officiosus adversus homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et in re misericordem se praebuerit et in testimoniis religiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis religiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio minime in testimoniis dicendis religiosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem rerum Romanarum auctorem laudare possum religiosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Atticorum aures teretes et religiosas qui se accommodant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ephorus vero non est religiosissimae fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosissimis verbis jurare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40979.6" n="B" level="2"> Of the objects of religious veneration (temples, statues, utensils, etc.), <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum sane sanctum et religiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum sacrum ac religiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so with sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Aesculapi religiosissimo fano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres antiquissima, religiosissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>, § 109; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosissimum simulacrum Jovis Imperatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 57</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">128: altaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra religiosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divini juris sunt veluti res sacrae et religiosae . . . (sunt res) religiosae quae diis manibus relictae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40979.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: dies religiosus, <hi rend="ital">a day upon which it was unlucky to undertake any thing important</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a day of evil omen</hi>, e. g. the dies Alliensis, the dies atri, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5, 2</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 379, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 14 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl>; and Fest. s. h. v. p. 231.—</sense><sense id="n40979.8" n="3" level="3"> Solum religiosum, <hi rend="ital">land consecrated by the burial of the dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 6 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^lĭgĭō-sē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n40979.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Piously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosius deos colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">templum religiosissime colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natalem religiosius celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40979.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Considerately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punctually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 22, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:65:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 65, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil religiose administrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid rogabatur, religiose promittebat,</quote> <trans><tr>considerately</tr>, <tr>cautiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosius rem rusticam colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:95" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëticen religiosissime veneror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
religo: <entryFree id="n40980" type="main" key="re^li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40980.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind fast</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n40980.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aspicite (Prometheum) religatum asperis Vinctumque saxis, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 23; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trahit Hectorem ad currum religatum Achillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:44:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 105</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">(Andromedam) ad duras religatam bracchia cautes Vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 671</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus post terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inter duos currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: remos struppis, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavam comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">religata comas in nodum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religata crines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem ferreis manibus injectis,</quote> <trans><tr>fastened with grapplingirons</tr>, <tr>grappled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversas trabes axibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 5; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 10: restim ad pinnam muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religato pro foribus cane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religatos rite videbat Carpere gramen equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum in vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desectam herbam,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind together</tr>, <tr>tie up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">folia lactucae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 39, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenā religari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenā aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religavit (Raphael) illud (daemonium) in deserto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 8, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40980.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., nautical t. t., <hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moor</hi> a ship to the shore: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad terram religare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 2</bibl> (with revincire): <cit><quote lang="la">ab aggere classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litore Threïcio classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religata in litore pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:248" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 248</bibl></cit>; <cb n="RELI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">funem (navis) in Cretam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Emathio litore funem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 860</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes ex arboribus ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit> pr.—</sense><sense id="n40980.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (prudentia) si extrinsecus religata pendeat, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>bound to external things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vinculo pietatis obstricti Deo et religati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 28, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapibusque simul religataque somno agmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 472</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40980.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unbind</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Cybele religat juga manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 84</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">resolvens juga): vitem resolvere ac religare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relino: <entryFree id="n40981" type="main" key="re^li^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unpitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passages): relevi dolia omnia, omnes serias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 51</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">servata mella Thesauris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to take out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 229</bibl></cit> (but for relevimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 38</bibl>, Fleck. reads rei erimus).</sense></entryFree>
relinquo: <entryFree id="n40982" type="main" key="re^linquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-linquo</orth>, <itype>līqui, lictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40982.0" n="I" level="1"> (With the idea of the <hi rend="ital">re</hi> predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi> (cf. desero, omitto). </sense><sense id="n40982.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to leave behind</hi> by removing one's self; <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move away from; to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi> (a person or thing). </sense><sense id="n40982.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum apud matrem domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse abiit foras, me reliquit pro atriensi in sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me filiis Relinquont quasi magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicerent non me plane de provinciā decessisse, quoniam alterum me reliquissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Fabium legatum cum legionibus II. castris praesidio relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me servum in servitute pro te hic reliqueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem, sc. in provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tergum hostem relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille omnibus precibus petere contendit, ut in Galliā relinqueretur,</quote> <trans><tr>might be left behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges pecorum . . . sub opacā valle reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 277</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea causa miles hic reliquit symbolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic exemplum reliquit ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hecuba) Hectoris in tumulo canum de vertice crinem . . . relinquit,</quote> <trans><tr>leaves behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cacumina silvae) limum tenent in fronde relictum,</quote> <trans><tr>left behind</tr>, <tr>remaining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:347" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 347</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi> one's self by moving away: <cit><quote lang="la">longius delatus aestu, sub sinistrā Britanniam relictam conspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque hos, jamque illos, populo mirante, relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:503" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 503</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be left behind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 626</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: hanc eram ipsam excusationem relicturus ad Caesarem, <hi rend="ital">was about to leave behind me just this excuse</hi> (for my departure), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeos in animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod coeptum est dici, relinquitur in cogitatione audientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate relictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetat relicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 97</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of rank or merit: (Homerus) omnes sine dubio et in omni genere eloquentiae procul a se reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40982.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To leave behind one</hi> by death; <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bequeath</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n40982.6" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea mortua est: reliquit filiam adulescentulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pauper cum duobus fratribus relictus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper jam a majoribus relictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri reliquit ei non magnum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem testamento reliquit hunc P. Quintium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei testamento sestertiūm milies relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si qui argentum omne legavit, videri potest signatam quoque pecuniam reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi reliquit haec quae habeo omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo, quid reliquit Phania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit> and 13: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos decem et tres reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum aeris alieni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus aut donatus aut testamento relictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui arva, greges, armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se testamento liberum relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave behind</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum ac virtutum nostrarum effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sic sunt, haud multum heredem juvant, Sibi vero hanc laudem relinquont: vixit, dum vixit, bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statum civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: memoriam<pb n="1558" /> <cb n="RELI" />  aut brevem aut nullam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum audaciae suae aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae scripta nobis summi ex Graeciā sapientissimique homines reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum in Originibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta posteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">in scriptis relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes reliquit et annales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo tantum volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum de suis rebus imperfectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>;
