cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si non omnia vates Ficta reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater, o relictum Filiae nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To leave</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">behind;</hi> <hi rend="ital">to leave remaining; to allow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permit to remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40982.9" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil relinquo in aedibus, Nec vas, nec vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis autem non modo granum nullum, sed ne paleae quidem ex omni fructu atque ex annuo labore relinquerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de tanto patrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus partem illi adtribuit, partem sibi reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustioribus portis relictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">41: unam (filiam) minimamque relinque,</quote> <trans><tr>leave to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pauca aratro jugera regiae Moles relinquent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapis meliora relinquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis apta tibi tua dona relinquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec porcis hodie comedenda relinquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habitanda fana Apris reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquebatur una per Sequanos via,</quote> <trans><tr>remained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā ex parte leniter acclivis aditus relinquebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum paucis relictum videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud dicionis Atheniensium praeter ipsam urbem reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40982.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi corpori reliqueris Tuo potestatem coloris ulli capiendi mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam igitur relinquis populari rei publicae laudem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis non modo dignitatis retinendae, sed ne libertatis quidem recuperandae spes relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterorum sententiis semotis, relinquitur non mihi cum Torquato, sed virtuti cum voluptate certatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua spes in fugā relinqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā provocatione ad populum contra necem et verbera relicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis igitur relictus est objurgandi locus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est preci loci relictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in another sense: plane nec precibus nostris nec admonitionibus relinquit locum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he leaves no occasion for them</tr>, <tr>renders them superfluous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui iniquo relinqueremus vituperandi locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui nullum sibi ad cognoscendum spatium relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium deliberandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Eun, 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eun, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita turpis ne morti quidem honestae locum relinquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:253" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 253</bibl> (v. Bernhardy ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita relicta est tantum modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod munitioni castrorum tempus relinqui volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi consilium et virtutis vestrae regimen relinquite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem alicui relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veniae vel saevitiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 41</bibl></cit>: leto, poenaeque, id. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 217</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem direptioni et incendiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>, <tr>surrender</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu relinquas hominem innocentem ad alicujus tui dissimilis quaestum,</quote> <trans><tr>do not leave</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in alicujus spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(metus) Omnia suffundens mortis nigrore, neque ullam Esse voluptatem liquidam puramque relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:703" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 703</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ex parvo nobis tantundem haurire relinquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:708" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 708</bibl>: nihil relinquitur nisi fuga, <hi rend="ital">there is nothing left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, etc., Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquitur illud, quod vociferari non destitit, non debuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 34, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nihil relicti quicquam aliud jam esse intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 81</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> relinquitur, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">621): relinquitur, ut, si vincimur in Hispaniā, quiescamus,</quote> <trans><tr>it remains</tr>, <tr>that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: relinquebatur, ut neque longius ab agmine legionum discedi <cb n="RELI" /> Caesar pateretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— In a logical conclusion: relinquitur ergo, ut omnia tria genera sint causarum, <hi rend="ital">hence it follows that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.11" n="3" level="3"> With double predicate, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">behind</hi> in a certain state; <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer to be</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum Plautus locum Reliquit integrum,</quote> <trans><tr>has left untouched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum integram rem et causam reliquerim,</quote> <trans><tr>have left unaltered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaptius me rogat, ut rem sic relinquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">12: Morini, quos Caesar in Britanniam proficiscens pacatos reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amici, quos incorruptos Jugurtha reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquit (eam) Incertam et tristi turbatam volnere mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) in litore deligatas ad ancoram relinquebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat aeger in praesidio relictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediis lacerā nave relinquor aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod insepultos reliquissent eos, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid incohatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptam oppugnationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>, <tr>quit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incoepta fila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecta sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus incoeptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba imperfecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro effectis relinquunt, vixdum incohata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid injudicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid neglectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas copias sine imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ture aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum in ambiguo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem nullam nominabo: tantum in medio relinquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">correptio in dubio relicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40982.12" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of the verb predominant.) <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go away from; to forsake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n40982.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n40982.14" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illaec obsecrost quae me hic reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: relinquamus nebulonem hunc, Scip. Afr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te hic lubens relinquo neque abeo abs te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum propinquosque reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis locis superioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:36" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci relinquendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilio relicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus relictum Respicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 873</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma relinquenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles clamore relinqui (sc.: a bubus),</quote> <trans><tr>were left behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 216</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres Ova relinquebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 802</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n40982.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: me somnu' reliquit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 52 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vita reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 63</bibl></cit>: reliquit aliquem vita, for <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 327</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vita tuos reliquerit artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 339</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also, reversely: animam relinquam potius, quam illas deseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 547</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen vitale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consitus sum senectute, vires Reliquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus reliquit euntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni honestate relictus,</quote> <trans><tr>abandoned</tr>, <tr>destitute of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab alterā (quartanā) relictum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 290</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40982.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to leave in the lurch; to forsake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi>, etc. (v. desero, destituo, prodo). </sense><sense id="n40982.17" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ... Reliquit deseruitque me,</quote> <trans><tr>has forsaken me</tr>, <tr>has given me the slip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquit me homo atque abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succurrere relictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 290</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the forsaking of a lover by his mistress,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos, qui ex fugā evaserant, reliquerunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>let them escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19</bibl></cit>. — Of things, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum si relinquo ac non peto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores signa relinquendi et deserendi castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">relictā non bene parmulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40982.18" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relinquish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem et causam et utilitatem communem non relinquere solum, sed etiam prodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 50</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">derelinquo jam communem causam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 103</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">jus suum dissolute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectum, cum ad summum perduxerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, <cb n="RELI" /> 1, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) Quod cupide petiit, mature plena reliquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: eum rogato, ut relinquat alias res et huc veniat, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay aside every thing else</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus relictis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">relictis rebus (omnibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1071" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1071</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: res omnes relictas habeo prae quod tu velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia relinques, si me amabis, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et agrorum et armorum cultum,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>, <tr>neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu ea relinquis et deseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:36:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium exquirendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum alternis annis,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer to lie fallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca relicta,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>, <tr>wild lands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 42" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 42</bibl></cit> Goes.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">relictae possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites bellum illud, quod erat in manibus, reliquisse,</quote> <trans><tr>abandoned</tr>, <tr>relinquished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. possessionem, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise the siege</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes relinquo, libidines praetereo,</quote> <trans><tr>leave unmentioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulto relinquere (locum), opp. praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc certe neque praetermittendum neque relinquendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">audistis haec, judices, quae nunc ego omnia praetereo et relinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 165</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur injurias tuas conjunctas cum publicis reliquisti?</quote> <trans><tr>left unnoticed</tr>, <tr>uncensured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:33:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 33, § 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim et causam efficiendi reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos legatum omni supplicio interfectum relinquetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est, qui vim hominibus armatis factam relinqui putet oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si plane contueare, mirari multa relinquas,</quote> <trans><tr>leave off</tr>, <tr>cease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 654</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
